build your own vue compiler-sfc

compiler-dom

build your own vue compiler-dom

   1: /** jsx?|tsx? file header */
   2: let debugOn = true
   3: let currentLogKey = 'cc'
   4: let __BROWSER__ = typeof window !== 'undefined'
   5: let logs = {}
   6: const __DEV__ = true
   7: const log = (fn, message) => {
   8:   if (debugOn) {
   9:     if (message === undefined) {
  10:       console.log(fn)
  11:     } else {
  12:       console.log(`[${fn}] ${message}`)
  13:     }
  14:   }
  15: }
  16: const logOn = () => (debugOn = true)
  17: const logOff = () => (debugOn = false)
  18: const logEnd = (hint = 'END') => {
  19:   const m = `--------- ${hint} ---------`
  20:   if (debugOn) pushLog(m, 'title')
  21:   return m
  22: }
  23: const logBr = () => console.log('\n')
  24: let debugTraverseOn = false
  25: const logTraverseOn = () => (debugTraverseOn = true)
  26: const logTraverseOff = () => (debugTraverseOn = false)
  27: const logg = (hint, ...msg) => {
  28:   if (!debugTraverseOn && hint === 'traverseNode') return
  29:   if (debugOn) {
  30:     const m = logEnd(hint)
  31:     msg.forEach((m) => pushLog(m))
  32:   }
  33: }
  34: function pushLog(m, type = 'normal') {
  35:   ;(logs[currentLogKey] || (logs[currentLogKey] = [])).push({ value: m, type })
  36:   log(m)
  37: }
  38: function clearLog(key) {
  39:   if (key) {
  40:     logs[key] = []
  41:   } else {
  42:     logs = {}
  43:   }
  44: }
  45: 
  46: let w = {}
  47: let debugEle = null
  48: if (__BROWSER__) {
  49:   w = typeof window !== 'undefined' ? window : {}
  50: }
  51: w.log = (msg, isLine = false) => {
  52:   if (debugEle) {
  53:     const cls = ['debug', isLine ? 'line' : ''].filter(Boolen)
  54:     ele.innerHTML = `${debugEl.innerHTML}<pre class="${cls.join(' ')}"><code>${
  55:       typeof msg === 'object' ? syntaxHighlight(msg) : msg
  56:     }</code></pre>`
  57:     return ele.innerHTML
  58:   }
  59: }
  60: 
  61: function syntaxHighlight(json) {
  62:   if (typeof json != 'string') {
  63:     json = JSON.stringify(json, undefined, 2)
  64:   }
  65:   json = json.replace(/&/g, '&amp;').replace(/</g, '&lt;').replace(/>/g, '&gt;')
  66:   return json.replace(
  67:     /("(\\u[a-zA-Z0-9]{4}|\\[^u]|[^\\"])*"(\s*:)?|\b(true|false|null)\b|-?\d+(?:\.\d*)?(?:[eE][+\-]?\d+)?)/g,
  68:     function (match) {
  69:       var cls = 'number'
  70:       if (/^"/.test(match)) {
  71:         if (/:$/.test(match)) {
  72:           cls = 'key'
  73:         } else {
  74:           cls = 'string'
  75:         }
  76:       } else if (/true|false/.test(match)) {
  77:         cls = 'boolean'
  78:       } else if (/null/.test(match)) {
  79:         cls = 'null'
  80:       }
  81:       return '<span class="' + cls + '">' + match + '</span>'
  82:     }
  83:   )
  84: }
  85: 
  86: let babelParser
  87: if (!__BROWSER__) {
  88:   babelParser = require(process.env.NODE_LIB + '/@babel/parser')
  89: }
  90: // The default decoder only provides escapes for characters reserved as part of
  91: // the template syntax, and is only used if the custom renderer did not provide
  92: // a platform-specific decoder.
  93: const decodeRE = /&(gt|lt|amp|apos|quot);/g
  94: const decodeMap = {
  95:   gt: '>',
  96:   lt: '<',
  97:   amp: '&',
  98:   apos: "'",
  99:   quot: '"'
 100: }
 101: 
 102: const EMPTY_OBJ = {}
 103: const NO = () => false
 104: const NOOP = () => {}
 105: const locStub = {
 106:   source: '',
 107:   start: { line: 1, column: 1, offset: 0 },
 108:   end: { line: 1, column: 1, offset: 0 }
 109: }
 110: 
 111: const ConstantTypes = {
 112:   NOT_CONSTANT: 0,
 113:   CAN_SKIP_PATCH: 1,
 114:   CAN_HOIST: 2,
 115:   CAN_STRINGIFY: 3
 116: }
 117: 
 118: const ElementTypes = {
 119:   ELEMENT: 0,
 120:   COMPONENT: 1,
 121:   SLOT: 2,
 122:   TEMPLATE: 3
 123: }
 124: 
 125: const Namespaces = {
 126:   HTML: 0
 127: }
 128: 
 129: const NodeTypes = {
 130:   ROOT: 0,
 131:   ELEMENT: 1,
 132:   TEXT: 2,
 133:   COMMENT: 3,
 134:   SIMPLE_EXPRESSION: 4,
 135:   INTERPOLATION: 5,
 136:   ATTRIBUTE: 6,
 137:   DIRECTIVE: 7,
 138:   // containers
 139:   COMPOUND_EXPRESSION: 8,
 140:   IF: 9,
 141:   IF_BRANCH: 10,
 142:   FOR: 11,
 143:   TEXT_CALL: 12,
 144:   // codegen
 145:   VNODE_CALL: 13,
 146:   JS_CALL_EXPRESSION: 14,
 147:   JS_OBJECT_EXPRESSION: 15,
 148:   JS_PROPERTY: 16,
 149:   JS_ARRAY_EXPRESSION: 17,
 150:   JS_FUNCTION_EXPRESSION: 18,
 151:   JS_CONDITIONAL_EXPRESSION: 19,
 152:   JS_CACHE_EXPRESSION: 20,
 153: 
 154:   // ssr codegen
 155:   JS_BLOCK_STATEMENT: 21,
 156:   JS_TEMPLATE_LITERAL: 22,
 157:   JS_IF_STATEMENT: 23,
 158:   JS_ASSIGNMENT_EXPRESSION: 24,
 159:   JS_SEQUENCE_EXPRESSION: 25,
 160:   JS_RETURN_STATEMENT: 26
 161: }
 162: 
 163: const defaultParserOptions = {
 164:   delimiters: [`{{`, `}}`],
 165:   getNamespace: () => Namespaces.HTML,
 166:   getTextMode: () => TextModes.DATA,
 167:   isVoidTag: NO,
 168:   isPreTag: NO,
 169:   isCustomElement: NO,
 170:   decodeEntities: (rawText) =>
 171:     rawText.replace(decodeRE, (_, p1) => decodeMap[p1]),
 172:   onError: defaultOnError,
 173:   onWarn: defaultOnWarn,
 174:   comments: __DEV__
 175: }
 176: 
 177: const TagType = {
 178:   Start: 0,
 179:   End: 1
 180: }
 181: 
 182: const TextModes = {
 183:   DATA: 0,
 184:   RCDATA: 1,
 185:   RAWTEXT: 2,
 186:   CDATA: 3,
 187:   ATTRIBUTE_VALUE: 4
 188: }
 189: 
 190: const extend = Object.assign
 191: 
 192: function defaultOnError(error) {
 193:   throw error
 194: }
 195: 
 196: function defaultOnWarn(msg) {
 197:   __DEV__ && console.warn(`[Vue warn] ${msg.message}`)
 198: }
 199: 
 200: function makeMap(str, expectsLowerCase) {
 201:   const map = Object.create(null)
 202:   const list = str.split(',')
 203:   for (let i = 0; i < list.length; i++) {
 204:     map[list[i]] = true
 205:   }
 206:   return expectsLowerCase
 207:     ? (val) => !!map[val.toLowerCase()]
 208:     : (val) => !!map[val]
 209: }
 210: 
 211: const hasOwnProperty = Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty
 212: const hasOwn = (val, key) => hasOwnProperty.call(val, key)
 213: 
 214: const isArray = Array.isArray
 215: const isMap = (val) => toTypeString(val) === '[object Map]'
 216: const isSet = (val) => toTypeString(val) === '[object Set]'
 217: 
 218: const isDate = (val) => val instanceof Date
 219: const isFunction = (val) => typeof val === 'function'
 220: const isString = (val) => typeof val === 'string'
 221: const isSymbol = (val) => typeof val === 'symbol'
 222: const isObject = (val) => val !== null && typeof val === 'object'
 223: const onRE = /^on[^a-z]/
 224: const isOn = (key) => onRE.test(key)
 225: 
 226: const isPromise = (val) => {
 227:   return isObject(val) && isFunction(val.then) && isFunction(val.catch)
 228: }
 229: 
 230: const objectToString = Object.prototype.toString
 231: const toTypeString = (value) => objectToString.call(value)
 232: 
 233: const toRawType = (value) => {
 234:   // extract "RawType" from strings like "[object RawType]"
 235:   return toTypeString(value).slice(8, -1)
 236: }
 237: 
 238: function isText(node) {
 239:   //
 240:   return node.type === NodeTypes.INTERPOLATION || node.type === NodeTypes.TEXT
 241: }
 242: 
 243: const isPlainObject = (val) => toTypeString(val) === '[object Object]'
 244: const isIntegerKey = (key) =>
 245:   isString(key) &&
 246:   key !== 'NaN' &&
 247:   key[0] !== '-' &&
 248:   '' + parseInt(key, 10) === key
 249: 
 250: const isReservedProp = /*#__PURE__*/ makeMap(
 251:   // the leading comma is intentional so empty string "" is also included
 252:   ',key,ref,ref_for,ref_key,' +
 253:     'onVnodeBeforeMount,onVnodeMounted,' +
 254:     'onVnodeBeforeUpdate,onVnodeUpdated,' +
 255:     'onVnodeBeforeUnmount,onVnodeUnmounted'
 256: )
 257: 
 258: const GLOBALS_WHITE_LISTED =
 259:   'Infinity,undefined,NaN,isFinite,isNaN,parseFloat,parseInt,decodeURI,' +
 260:   'decodeURIComponent,encodeURI,encodeURIComponent,Math,Number,Date,Array,' +
 261:   'Object,Boolean,String,RegExp,Map,Set,JSON,Intl,BigInt'
 262: 
 263: const isGloballyWhitelisted = /*#__PURE__*/ makeMap(GLOBALS_WHITE_LISTED)
 264: 
 265: const nonIdentifierRE = /^\d|[^\$\w]/
 266: const isSimpleIdentifier = (name) => !nonIdentifierRE.test(name)
 267: 
 268: const isBuiltInDirective = /*#__PURE__*/ makeMap(
 269:   'bind,cloak,else-if,else,for,html,if,model,on,once,pre,show,slot,text,memo'
 270: )
 271: 
 272: function getCursor(context) {
 273:   const { column, line, offset } = context
 274:   return { column, line, offset }
 275: }
 276: 
 277: function getSelection(context, start, end) {
 278:   end = end || getCursor(context)
 279:   return {
 280:     start,
 281:     end,
 282:     source: context.originalSource.slice(start.offset, end.offset)
 283:   }
 284: }
 285: 
 286: function last(xs) {
 287:   return xs[xs.length - 1]
 288: }
 289: 
 290: function startsWith(source, searchString) {
 291:   return source.startsWith(searchString)
 292: }
 293: 
 294: function advancePositionWithMutation(
 295:   pos,
 296:   source,
 297:   numberOfCharacters = source.length
 298: ) {
 299:   let linesCount = 0
 300:   let lastNewLinePos = -1
 301:   for (let i = 0; i < numberOfCharacters; i++) {
 302:     if (source.charCodeAt(i) === 10 /* newline char code */) {
 303:       linesCount++
 304:       lastNewLinePos = i
 305:     }
 306:   }
 307: 
 308:   pos.offset += numberOfCharacters
 309:   pos.line += linesCount
 310:   pos.column =
 311:     lastNewLinePos === -1
 312:       ? pos.column + numberOfCharacters
 313:       : numberOfCharacters - lastNewLinePos
 314: 
 315:   return pos
 316: }
 317: 
 318: function advancePositionWithClone(
 319:   pos,
 320:   source,
 321:   numberOfCharacters = source.length
 322: ) {
 323:   return advancePositionWithMutation(
 324:     extend({}, pos),
 325:     source,
 326:     numberOfCharacters
 327:   )
 328: }
 329: 
 330: function advanceBy(context, numberOfCharacters) {
 331:   const { source } = context
 332:   advancePositionWithMutation(context, source, numberOfCharacters)
 333:   context.source = source.slice(numberOfCharacters)
 334: }
 335: 
 336: function advanceSpaces(context) {
 337:   const match = /^[\t\r\n\f ]+/.exec(context.source)
 338:   if (match) {
 339:     advanceBy(context, match[0].length)
 340:   }
 341: }
 342: 
 343: function getNewPosition(context, start, numberOfCharacters) {
 344:   return advancePositionWithClone(
 345:     start,
 346:     context.originalSource.slice(start.offset, numberOfCharacters),
 347:     numberOfCharacters
 348:   )
 349: }
 350: 
 351: function emitError(context, code, offset, loc = getCursor(context)) {
 352:   if (offset) {
 353:     loc.offset += offset
 354:     loc.column += offset
 355:   }
 356:   // ignore...
 357: }
 358: 
 359: function isEnd(context, mode, ancestors) {
 360:   const s = context.source
 361: 
 362:   switch (mode) {
 363:     case TextModes.DATA:
 364:       if (startsWith(s, '</')) {
 365:         // TODO: probably bad performance
 366:         for (let i = ancestors.length - 1; i >= 0; --i) {
 367:           if (startsWithEndTagOpen(s, ancestors[i].tag)) {
 368:             return true
 369:           }
 370:         }
 371:       }
 372:       break
 373: 
 374:     case TextModes.RCDATA:
 375:     case TextModes.RAWTEXT: {
 376:       const parent = last(ancestors)
 377:       if (parent && startsWithEndTagOpen(s, parent.tag)) {
 378:         return true
 379:       }
 380:       break
 381:     }
 382: 
 383:     case TextModes.CDATA:
 384:       if (startsWith(s, ']]>')) {
 385:         return true
 386:       }
 387:       break
 388:   }
 389: 
 390:   return !s
 391: }
 392: 
 393: function startsWithEndTagOpen(source, tag) {
 394:   return (
 395:     startsWith(source, '</') &&
 396:     source.slice(2, 2 + tag.length).toLowerCase() === tag.toLowerCase() &&
 397:     /[\t\r\n\f />]/.test(source[2 + tag.length] || '>')
 398:   )
 399: }
 400: 
 401: const cacheStringFunction = (fn) => {
 402:   const cache = Object.create(null)
 403:   return (str) => {
 404:     const hit = cache[str]
 405:     return hit || (cache[str] = fn(str))
 406:   }
 407: }
 408: 
 409: const camelizeRE = /-(\w)/g
 410: const camelize = cacheStringFunction((str) => {
 411:   return str.replace(camelizeRE, (_, c) => (c ? c.toUpperCase() : ''))
 412: })
 413: 
 414: const hyphenateRE = /\B([A-Z])/g
 415: const hyphenate = cacheStringFunction((str) =>
 416:   str.replace(hyphenateRE, '-$1').toLowerCase()
 417: )
 418: const capitalize = cacheStringFunction(
 419:   (str) => str.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + str.slice(1)
 420: )
 421: const toHandlerKey = cacheStringFunction((str) =>
 422:   str ? `on${capitalize(str)}` : ``
 423: )
 424: 
 425: const isBuiltInType = (tag, expected) =>
 426:   tag === expected || tag === hyphenate(expected)
 427: 
 428: function isCoreComponent(tag) {
 429:   if (isBuiltInType(tag, 'Teleport')) {
 430:     return TELEPORT
 431:   } else if (isBuiltInType(tag, 'Suspense')) {
 432:     return SUSPENSE
 433:   } else if (isBuiltInType(tag, 'KeepAlive')) {
 434:     return KEEP_ALIVE
 435:   } else if (isBuiltInType(tag, 'BaseTransition')) {
 436:     return BASE_TRANSITION
 437:   }
 438: }
 439: 
 440: const isSpecialTemplateDirective = /*#__PURE__*/ makeMap(
 441:   `if,else,else-if,for,slot`
 442: )
 443: 
 444: function getVNodeHelper(ssr, isComponent) {
 445:   return ssr || isComponent ? CREATE_VNODE : CREATE_ELEMENT_VNODE
 446: }
 447: 
 448: function getVNodeBlockHelper(ssr, isComponent) {
 449:   return ssr || isComponent ? CREATE_BLOCK : CREATE_ELEMENT_BLOCK
 450: }
 451: 
 452: function isSingleElementRoot(root, child) {
 453:   const { children } = root
 454:   return (
 455:     children.length === 1 &&
 456:     child.type === NodeTypes.ELEMENT &&
 457:     !isSlotOutlet(child)
 458:   )
 459: }
 460: 
 461: function isSlotOutlet(node) {
 462:   return node.type === NodeTypes.ELEMENT && node.tagType === ElementTypes.SLOT
 463: }
 464: 
 465: function findDir(node, name, allowEmpty = false) {
 466:   for (let i = 0; i < node.props.length; i++) {
 467:     const p = node.props[i]
 468:     if (
 469:       p.type === NodeTypes.DIRECTIVE &&
 470:       (allowEmpty || p.exp) &&
 471:       (isString(name) ? p.name === name : name.test(p.name))
 472:     ) {
 473:       return p
 474:     }
 475:   }
 476: }
 477: 
 478: function findProp(node, name, dynamicOnly = false, allowEmpty = false) {
 479:   for (let i = 0; i < node.props.length; i++) {
 480:     const p = node.props[i]
 481:     if (p.type === NodeTypes.ATTRIBUTE) {
 482:       if (dynamicOnly) continue
 483:       if (p.name === name && (p.value || allowEmpty)) {
 484:         return p
 485:       }
 486:     } else if (
 487:       p.name === 'bind' &&
 488:       (p.exp || allowEmpty) &&
 489:       isStaticArgOf(p.arg, name)
 490:     ) {
 491:       return p
 492:     }
 493:   }
 494: }
 495: 
 496: const isStaticExp = (p) => p.type === NodeTypes.SIMPLE_EXPRESSION && p.isStatic
 497: 
 498: function isStaticArgOf(arg, name) {
 499:   return !!(arg && isStaticExp(arg) && arg.content === name)
 500: }
 501: 
 502: function isVSlot(p) {
 503:   return p.type === NodeTypes.DIRECTIVE && p.name === 'slot'
 504: }
 505: 
 506: function getMemoedVNodeCall(node) {
 507:   if (node.type === NodeTypes.JS_CALL_EXPRESSION && node.callee === WITH_MEMO) {
 508:     return node.arguments[1].returns
 509:   } else {
 510:     return node
 511:   }
 512: }
 513: 
 514: function getInnerRange(loc, offset, length) {
 515:   const source = loc.source.slice(offset, offset + length)
 516:   const newLoc = {
 517:     source,
 518:     start: advancePositionWithClone(loc.start, loc.source, offset),
 519:     end: loc.end
 520:   }
 521: 
 522:   if (length != null) {
 523:     newLoc.end = advancePositionWithClone(
 524:       loc.start,
 525:       loc.source,
 526:       offset + length
 527:     )
 528:   }
 529: 
 530:   return newLoc
 531: }
 532: 
 533: function toValidAssetId(name, type) {
 534:   // see issue#4422, we need adding identifier on validAssetId if variable `name` has specific character
 535:   return `_${type}_${name.replace(/[^\w]/g, (searchValue, replaceValue) => {
 536:     return searchValue === '-' ? '_' : name.charCodeAt(replaceValue).toString()
 537:   })}`
 538: }
 539: 
 540: function isTemplateNode(node) {
 541:   return (
 542:     node.type === NodeTypes.ELEMENT && node.tagType === ElementTypes.TEMPLATE
 543:   )
 544: }
 545: 
 546: function isComponent(tag, props, context) {
 547:   const options = context.options
 548:   if (options.isCustomElement(tag)) {
 549:     return false
 550:   }
 551:   if (
 552:     tag === 'component' ||
 553:     /^[A-Z]/.test(tag) ||
 554:     isCoreComponent(tag) ||
 555:     (options.isBuiltInComponent && options.isBuiltInComponent(tag)) ||
 556:     (options.isNativeTag && !options.isNativeTag(tag))
 557:   ) {
 558:     return true
 559:   }
 560:   // at this point the tag should be a native tag, but check for potential "is"
 561:   // casting
 562:   for (let i = 0; i < props.length; i++) {
 563:     const p = props[i]
 564:     if (p.type === NodeTypes.ATTRIBUTE) {
 565:       if (p.name === 'is' && p.value) {
 566:         if (p.value.content.startsWith('vue:')) {
 567:           return true
 568:         }
 569:       }
 570:     } else {
 571:       // directive
 572:       // v-is (TODO Deprecate)
 573:       if (p.name === 'is') {
 574:         return true
 575:       }
 576:     }
 577:   }
 578: }
 579: 
 580: function pushNode(nodes, node) {
 581:   if (node.type === NodeTypes.TEXT) {
 582:     const prev = last(nodes)
 583:     // Merge if both this and the previous node are text and those are
 584:     // consecutive. This happens for cases like "a < b".
 585:     if (
 586:       prev &&
 587:       prev.type === NodeTypes.TEXT &&
 588:       prev.loc.end.offset === node.loc.start.offset
 589:     ) {
 590:       prev.content += node.content
 591:       prev.loc.end = node.loc.end
 592:       prev.loc.source += node.loc.source
 593:       return
 594:     }
 595:   }
 596: 
 597:   nodes.push(node)
 598: }
 599: 
 600: const FRAGMENT = Symbol(__DEV__ ? `Fragment` : ``)
 601: const TELEPORT = Symbol(__DEV__ ? `Teleport` : ``)
 602: const SUSPENSE = Symbol(__DEV__ ? `Suspense` : ``)
 603: const KEEP_ALIVE = Symbol(__DEV__ ? `KeepAlive` : ``)
 604: const BASE_TRANSITION = Symbol(__DEV__ ? `BaseTransition` : ``)
 605: const OPEN_BLOCK = Symbol(__DEV__ ? `openBlock` : ``)
 606: const CREATE_BLOCK = Symbol(__DEV__ ? `createBlock` : ``)
 607: const CREATE_ELEMENT_BLOCK = Symbol(__DEV__ ? `createElementBlock` : ``)
 608: const CREATE_VNODE = Symbol(__DEV__ ? `createVNode` : ``)
 609: const CREATE_ELEMENT_VNODE = Symbol(__DEV__ ? `createElementVNode` : ``)
 610: const CREATE_COMMENT = Symbol(__DEV__ ? `createCommentVNode` : ``)
 611: const CREATE_TEXT = Symbol(__DEV__ ? `createTextVNode` : ``)
 612: const CREATE_STATIC = Symbol(__DEV__ ? `createStaticVNode` : ``)
 613: const RESOLVE_COMPONENT = Symbol(__DEV__ ? `resolveComponent` : ``)
 614: const RESOLVE_DYNAMIC_COMPONENT = Symbol(
 615:   __DEV__ ? `resolveDynamicComponent` : ``
 616: )
 617: const RESOLVE_DIRECTIVE = Symbol(__DEV__ ? `resolveDirective` : ``)
 618: const RESOLVE_FILTER = Symbol(__DEV__ ? `resolveFilter` : ``)
 619: const WITH_DIRECTIVES = Symbol(__DEV__ ? `withDirectives` : ``)
 620: const RENDER_LIST = Symbol(__DEV__ ? `renderList` : ``)
 621: const RENDER_SLOT = Symbol(__DEV__ ? `renderSlot` : ``)
 622: const CREATE_SLOTS = Symbol(__DEV__ ? `createSlots` : ``)
 623: const TO_DISPLAY_STRING = Symbol(__DEV__ ? `toDisplayString` : ``)
 624: const MERGE_PROPS = Symbol(__DEV__ ? `mergeProps` : ``)
 625: const NORMALIZE_CLASS = Symbol(__DEV__ ? `normalizeClass` : ``)
 626: const NORMALIZE_STYLE = Symbol(__DEV__ ? `normalizeStyle` : ``)
 627: const NORMALIZE_PROPS = Symbol(__DEV__ ? `normalizeProps` : ``)
 628: const GUARD_REACTIVE_PROPS = Symbol(__DEV__ ? `guardReactiveProps` : ``)
 629: const TO_HANDLERS = Symbol(__DEV__ ? `toHandlers` : ``)
 630: const CAMELIZE = Symbol(__DEV__ ? `camelize` : ``)
 631: const CAPITALIZE = Symbol(__DEV__ ? `capitalize` : ``)
 632: const TO_HANDLER_KEY = Symbol(__DEV__ ? `toHandlerKey` : ``)
 633: const SET_BLOCK_TRACKING = Symbol(__DEV__ ? `setBlockTracking` : ``)
 634: const PUSH_SCOPE_ID = Symbol(__DEV__ ? `pushScopeId` : ``)
 635: const POP_SCOPE_ID = Symbol(__DEV__ ? `popScopeId` : ``)
 636: const WITH_CTX = Symbol(__DEV__ ? `withCtx` : ``)
 637: const UNREF = Symbol(__DEV__ ? `unref` : ``)
 638: const IS_REF = Symbol(__DEV__ ? `isRef` : ``)
 639: const WITH_MEMO = Symbol(__DEV__ ? `withMemo` : ``)
 640: const IS_MEMO_SAME = Symbol(__DEV__ ? `isMemoSame` : ``)
 641: 
 642: // Name mapping for runtime helpers that need to be imported from 'vue' in
 643: // generated code. Make sure these are correctly exported in the runtime!
 644: // Using `any` here because TS doesn't allow symbols as index type.
 645: const helperNameMap = {
 646:   [FRAGMENT]: `Fragment`,
 647:   [TELEPORT]: `Teleport`,
 648:   [SUSPENSE]: `Suspense`,
 649:   [KEEP_ALIVE]: `KeepAlive`,
 650:   [BASE_TRANSITION]: `BaseTransition`,
 651:   [OPEN_BLOCK]: `openBlock`,
 652:   [CREATE_BLOCK]: `createBlock`,
 653:   [CREATE_ELEMENT_BLOCK]: `createElementBlock`,
 654:   [CREATE_VNODE]: `createVNode`,
 655:   [CREATE_ELEMENT_VNODE]: `createElementVNode`,
 656:   [CREATE_COMMENT]: `createCommentVNode`,
 657:   [CREATE_TEXT]: `createTextVNode`,
 658:   [CREATE_STATIC]: `createStaticVNode`,
 659:   [RESOLVE_COMPONENT]: `resolveComponent`,
 660:   [RESOLVE_DYNAMIC_COMPONENT]: `resolveDynamicComponent`,
 661:   [RESOLVE_DIRECTIVE]: `resolveDirective`,
 662:   [RESOLVE_FILTER]: `resolveFilter`,
 663:   [WITH_DIRECTIVES]: `withDirectives`,
 664:   [RENDER_LIST]: `renderList`,
 665:   [RENDER_SLOT]: `renderSlot`,
 666:   [CREATE_SLOTS]: `createSlots`,
 667:   [TO_DISPLAY_STRING]: `toDisplayString`,
 668:   [MERGE_PROPS]: `mergeProps`,
 669:   [NORMALIZE_CLASS]: `normalizeClass`,
 670:   [NORMALIZE_STYLE]: `normalizeStyle`,
 671:   [NORMALIZE_PROPS]: `normalizeProps`,
 672:   [GUARD_REACTIVE_PROPS]: `guardReactiveProps`,
 673:   [TO_HANDLERS]: `toHandlers`,
 674:   [CAMELIZE]: `camelize`,
 675:   [CAPITALIZE]: `capitalize`,
 676:   [TO_HANDLER_KEY]: `toHandlerKey`,
 677:   [SET_BLOCK_TRACKING]: `setBlockTracking`,
 678:   [PUSH_SCOPE_ID]: `pushScopeId`,
 679:   [POP_SCOPE_ID]: `popScopeId`,
 680:   [WITH_CTX]: `withCtx`,
 681:   [UNREF]: `unref`,
 682:   [IS_REF]: `isRef`,
 683:   [WITH_MEMO]: `withMemo`,
 684:   [IS_MEMO_SAME]: `isMemoSame`
 685: }
 686: 
 687: function registerRuntimeHelpers(helpers) {
 688:   Object.getOwnPropertySymbols(helpers).forEach((s) => {
 689:     helperNameMap[s] = helpers[s]
 690:   })
 691: }
 692: 
 693: /**
 694:  * Patch flags are optimization hints generated by the compiler.
 695:  * when a block with dynamicChildren is encountered during diff, the algorithm
 696:  * enters "optimized mode". In this mode, we know that the vdom is produced by
 697:  * a render function generated by the compiler, so the algorithm only needs to
 698:  * handle updates explicitly marked by these patch flags.
 699:  *
 700:  * Patch flags can be combined using the | bitwise operator and can be checked
 701:  * using the & operator, e.g.
 702:  *
 703:  * ```js
 704:  * const flag = TEXT | CLASS
 705:  * if (flag & TEXT) { ... }
 706:  * ```
 707:  *
 708:  * Check the `patchElement` function in '../../runtime-core/src/renderer.ts' to see how the
 709:  * flags are handled during diff.
 710:  */
 711: const PatchFlags = {
 712:   /**
 713:    * Indicates an element with dynamic textContent (children fast path)
 714:    */
 715:   TEXT: 1,
 716: 
 717:   /**
 718:    * Indicates an element with dynamic class binding.
 719:    */
 720:   CLASS: 1 << 1,
 721: 
 722:   /**
 723:    * Indicates an element with dynamic style
 724:    * The compiler pre-compiles static string styles into static objects
 725:    * + detects and hoists inline static objects
 726:    * e.g. `style="color: red"` and `:style="{ color: 'red' }"` both get hoisted
 727:    * as:
 728:    * ```js
 729:    * const style = { color: 'red' }
 730:    * render() { return e('div', { style }) }
 731:    * ```
 732:    */
 733:   STYLE: 1 << 2,
 734: 
 735:   /**
 736:    * Indicates an element that has non-class/style dynamic props.
 737:    * Can also be on a component that has any dynamic props (includes
 738:    * class/style). when this flag is present, the vnode also has a dynamicProps
 739:    * array that contains the keys of the props that may change so the runtime
 740:    * can diff them faster (without having to worry about removed props)
 741:    */
 742:   PROPS: 1 << 3,
 743: 
 744:   /**
 745:    * Indicates an element with props with dynamic keys. When keys change, a full
 746:    * diff is always needed to remove the old key. This flag is mutually
 747:    * exclusive with CLASS, STYLE and PROPS.
 748:    */
 749:   FULL_PROPS: 1 << 4,
 750: 
 751:   /**
 752:    * Indicates an element with event listeners (which need to be attached
 753:    * during hydration)
 754:    */
 755:   HYDRATE_EVENTS: 1 << 5,
 756: 
 757:   /**
 758:    * Indicates a fragment whose children order doesn't change.
 759:    */
 760:   STABLE_FRAGMENT: 1 << 6,
 761: 
 762:   /**
 763:    * Indicates a fragment with keyed or partially keyed children
 764:    */
 765:   KEYED_FRAGMENT: 1 << 7,
 766: 
 767:   /**
 768:    * Indicates a fragment with unkeyed children.
 769:    */
 770:   UNKEYED_FRAGMENT: 1 << 8,
 771: 
 772:   /**
 773:    * Indicates an element that only needs non-props patching, e.g. ref or
 774:    * directives (onVnodeXXX hooks). since every patched vnode checks for refs
 775:    * and onVnodeXXX hooks, it simply marks the vnode so that a parent block
 776:    * will track it.
 777:    */
 778:   NEED_PATCH: 1 << 9,
 779: 
 780:   /**
 781:    * Indicates a component with dynamic slots (e.g. slot that references a v-for
 782:    * iterated value, or dynamic slot names).
 783:    * Components with this flag are always force updated.
 784:    */
 785:   DYNAMIC_SLOTS: 1 << 10,
 786: 
 787:   /**
 788:    * Indicates a fragment that was created only because the user has placed
 789:    * comments at the root level of a template. This is a dev-only flag since
 790:    * comments are stripped in production.
 791:    */
 792:   DEV_ROOT_FRAGMENT: 1 << 11,
 793: 
 794:   /**
 795:    * SPECIAL FLAGS -------------------------------------------------------------
 796:    * Special flags are negative integers. They are never matched against using
 797:    * bitwise operators (bitwise matching should only happen in branches where
 798:    * patchFlag > 0), and are mutually exclusive. When checking for a special
 799:    * flag, simply check patchFlag === FLAG.
 800:    */
 801: 
 802:   /**
 803:    * Indicates a hoisted static vnode. This is a hint for hydration to skip
 804:    * the entire sub tree since static content never needs to be updated.
 805:    */
 806:   HOISTED: -1,
 807:   /**
 808:    * A special flag that indicates that the diffing algorithm should bail out
 809:    * of optimized mode. For example, on block fragments created by renderSlot()
 810:    * when encountering non-compiler generated slots (i.e. manually written
 811:    * render functions, which should always be fully diffed)
 812:    * OR manually cloneVNodes
 813:    */
 814:   BAIL: -2
 815: }
 816: 
 817: /**
 818:  * dev only flag -> name mapping
 819:  */
 820: const PatchFlagNames = {
 821:   [PatchFlags.TEXT]: `TEXT`,
 822:   [PatchFlags.CLASS]: `CLASS`,
 823:   [PatchFlags.STYLE]: `STYLE`,
 824:   [PatchFlags.PROPS]: `PROPS`,
 825:   [PatchFlags.FULL_PROPS]: `FULL_PROPS`,
 826:   [PatchFlags.HYDRATE_EVENTS]: `HYDRATE_EVENTS`,
 827:   [PatchFlags.STABLE_FRAGMENT]: `STABLE_FRAGMENT`,
 828:   [PatchFlags.KEYED_FRAGMENT]: `KEYED_FRAGMENT`,
 829:   [PatchFlags.UNKEYED_FRAGMENT]: `UNKEYED_FRAGMENT`,
 830:   [PatchFlags.NEED_PATCH]: `NEED_PATCH`,
 831:   [PatchFlags.DYNAMIC_SLOTS]: `DYNAMIC_SLOTS`,
 832:   [PatchFlags.DEV_ROOT_FRAGMENT]: `DEV_ROOT_FRAGMENT`,
 833:   [PatchFlags.HOISTED]: `HOISTED`,
 834:   [PatchFlags.BAIL]: `BAIL`
 835: }
 836: 
 837: function genFlagText(flag, names = PatchFlagNames) {
 838:   if (isArray(flag)) {
 839:     let f = 0
 840:     flag.forEach((ff) => {
 841:       f |= ff
 842:     })
 843:     return `${f} /* ${flag.map((f) => names[f]).join(', ')} */`
 844:   } else {
 845:     return `${flag} /* ${names[flag]} */`
 846:   }
 847: }
 848: 
 849: const propsHelperSet = new Set([NORMALIZE_PROPS, GUARD_REACTIVE_PROPS])
 850: 
 851: function getUnnormalizedProps(props, callPath = []) {
 852:   if (
 853:     props &&
 854:     !isString(props) &&
 855:     props.type === NodeTypes.JS_CALL_EXPRESSION
 856:   ) {
 857:     const callee = props.callee
 858:     if (!isString(callee) && propsHelperSet.has(callee)) {
 859:       return getUnnormalizedProps(props.arguments[0], callPath.concat(props))
 860:     }
 861:   }
 862:   return [props, callPath]
 863: }
 864: 
 865: function injectProp(node, prop, context) {
 866:   let propsWithInjection
 867:   /**
 868:    * 1. mergeProps(...)
 869:    * 2. toHandlers(...)
 870:    * 3. normalizeProps(...)
 871:    * 4. normalizeProps(guardReactiveProps(...))
 872:    *
 873:    * we need to get the real props before normalization
 874:    */
 875:   let props =
 876:     node.type === NodeTypes.VNODE_CALL ? node.props : node.arguments[2]
 877:   let callPath = []
 878:   let parentCall
 879:   if (
 880:     props &&
 881:     !isString(props) &&
 882:     props.type === NodeTypes.JS_CALL_EXPRESSION
 883:   ) {
 884:     const ret = getUnnormalizedProps(props)
 885:     props = ret[0]
 886:     callPath = ret[1]
 887:     parentCall = callPath[callPath.length - 1]
 888:   }
 889: 
 890:   if (props == null || isString(props)) {
 891:     propsWithInjection = createObjectExpression([prop])
 892:   } else if (props.type === NodeTypes.JS_CALL_EXPRESSION) {
 893:     // merged props... add ours
 894:     // only inject key to object literal if it's the first argument so that
 895:     // if doesn't override user provided keys
 896:     const first = props.arguments[0] | JSChildNode
 897:     if (!isString(first) && first.type === NodeTypes.JS_OBJECT_EXPRESSION) {
 898:       first.properties.unshift(prop)
 899:     } else {
 900:       if (props.callee === TO_HANDLERS) {
 901:         // #2366
 902:         propsWithInjection = createCallExpression(context.helper(MERGE_PROPS), [
 903:           createObjectExpression([prop]),
 904:           props
 905:         ])
 906:       } else {
 907:         props.arguments.unshift(createObjectExpression([prop]))
 908:       }
 909:     }
 910:     !propsWithInjection && (propsWithInjection = props)
 911:   } else if (props.type === NodeTypes.JS_OBJECT_EXPRESSION) {
 912:     let alreadyExists = false
 913:     // check existing key to avoid overriding user provided keys
 914:     if (prop.key.type === NodeTypes.SIMPLE_EXPRESSION) {
 915:       const propKeyName = prop.key.content
 916:       alreadyExists = props.properties.some(
 917:         (p) =>
 918:           p.key.type === NodeTypes.SIMPLE_EXPRESSION &&
 919:           p.key.content === propKeyName
 920:       )
 921:     }
 922:     if (!alreadyExists) {
 923:       props.properties.unshift(prop)
 924:     }
 925:     propsWithInjection = props
 926:   } else {
 927:     // single v-bind with expression, return a merged replacement
 928:     propsWithInjection = createCallExpression(context.helper(MERGE_PROPS), [
 929:       createObjectExpression([prop]),
 930:       props
 931:     ])
 932:     // in the case of nested helper call, e.g. `normalizeProps(guardReactiveProps(props))`,
 933:     // it will be rewritten as `normalizeProps(mergeProps({ key: 0 }, props))`,
 934:     // the `guardReactiveProps` will no longer be needed
 935:     if (parentCall && parentCall.callee === GUARD_REACTIVE_PROPS) {
 936:       parentCall = callPath[callPath.length - 2]
 937:     }
 938:   }
 939:   if (node.type === NodeTypes.VNODE_CALL) {
 940:     if (parentCall) {
 941:       parentCall.arguments[0] = propsWithInjection
 942:     } else {
 943:       node.props = propsWithInjection
 944:     }
 945:   } else {
 946:     if (parentCall) {
 947:       parentCall.arguments[0] = propsWithInjection
 948:     } else {
 949:       node.arguments[2] = propsWithInjection
 950:     }
 951:   }
 952: }
 953: 
 954: const BindingTypes = {
 955:   /**
 956:    * returned from data()
 957:    */
 958:   DATA: 'data',
 959:   /**
 960:    * declared as a prop
 961:    */
 962:   PROPS: 'props',
 963:   /**
 964:    * a local alias of a `<script setup>` destructured prop.
 965:    * the original is stored in __propsAliases of the bindingMetadata object.
 966:    */
 967:   PROPS_ALIASED: 'props-aliased',
 968:   /**
 969:    * a let binding (may or may not be a ref)
 970:    */
 971:   SETUP_LET: 'setup-let',
 972:   /**
 973:    * a const binding that can never be a ref.
 974:    * these bindings don't need `unref()` calls when processed in inlined
 975:    * template expressions.
 976:    */
 977:   SETUP_CONST: 'setup-const',
 978:   /**
 979:    * a const binding that may be a ref.
 980:    */
 981:   SETUP_MAYBE_REF: 'setup-maybe-ref',
 982:   /**
 983:    * bindings that are guaranteed to be refs
 984:    */
 985:   SETUP_REF: 'setup-ref',
 986:   /**
 987:    * declared by other options, e.g. computed, inject
 988:    */
 989:   OPTIONS: 'options'
 990: }
 991: 
 992: class WalkerBase {
 993:   constructor() {
 994:     /** @type {boolean} */
 995:     this.should_skip = false
 996: 
 997:     /** @type {boolean} */
 998:     this.should_remove = false
 999: 
1000:     /** @type {BaseNode | null} */
1001:     this.replacement = null
1002: 
1003:     /** @type {WalkerContext} */
1004:     this.context = {
1005:       skip: () => (this.should_skip = true),
1006:       remove: () => (this.should_remove = true),
1007:       replace: (node) => (this.replacement = node)
1008:     }
1009:   }
1010: 
1011:   replace(parent, prop, index, node) {
1012:     if (parent) {
1013:       if (index !== null) {
1014:         parent[prop][index] = node
1015:       } else {
1016:         parent[prop] = node
1017:       }
1018:     }
1019:   }
1020: 
1021:   remove(parent, prop, index) {
1022:     if (parent) {
1023:       if (index !== null) {
1024:         parent[prop].splice(index, 1)
1025:       } else {
1026:         delete parent[prop]
1027:       }
1028:     }
1029:   }
1030: }
1031: 
1032: class SyncWalker extends WalkerBase {
1033:   constructor(enter, leave) {
1034:     super()
1035: 
1036:     /** @type {SyncHandler} */
1037:     this.enter = enter
1038: 
1039:     /** @type {SyncHandler} */
1040:     this.leave = leave
1041:   }
1042: 
1043:   visit(node, parent, prop, index) {
1044:     if (node) {
1045:       if (this.enter) {
1046:         const _should_skip = this.should_skip
1047:         const _should_remove = this.should_remove
1048:         const _replacement = this.replacement
1049:         this.should_skip = false
1050:         this.should_remove = false
1051:         this.replacement = null
1052: 
1053:         this.enter.call(this.context, node, parent, prop, index)
1054: 
1055:         if (this.replacement) {
1056:           node = this.replacement
1057:           this.replace(parent, prop, index, node)
1058:         }
1059: 
1060:         if (this.should_remove) {
1061:           this.remove(parent, prop, index)
1062:         }
1063: 
1064:         const skipped = this.should_skip
1065:         const removed = this.should_remove
1066: 
1067:         this.should_skip = _should_skip
1068:         this.should_remove = _should_remove
1069:         this.replacement = _replacement
1070: 
1071:         if (skipped) return node
1072:         if (removed) return null
1073:       }
1074: 
1075:       for (const key in node) {
1076:         const value = node[key]
1077: 
1078:         if (typeof value !== 'object') {
1079:           continue
1080:         } else if (Array.isArray(value)) {
1081:           for (let i = 0; i < value.length; i += 1) {
1082:             if (value[i] !== null && typeof value[i].type === 'string') {
1083:               if (!this.visit(value[i], node, key, i)) {
1084:                 // removed
1085:                 i--
1086:               }
1087:             }
1088:           }
1089:         } else if (value !== null && typeof value.type === 'string') {
1090:           this.visit(value, node, key, null)
1091:         }
1092:       }
1093: 
1094:       if (this.leave) {
1095:         const _replacement = this.replacement
1096:         const _should_remove = this.should_remove
1097:         this.replacement = null
1098:         this.should_remove = false
1099: 
1100:         this.leave.call(this.context, node, parent, prop, index)
1101: 
1102:         if (this.replacement) {
1103:           node = this.replacement
1104:           this.replace(parent, prop, index, node)
1105:         }
1106: 
1107:         if (this.should_remove) {
1108:           this.remove(parent, prop, index)
1109:         }
1110: 
1111:         const removed = this.should_remove
1112: 
1113:         this.replacement = _replacement
1114:         this.should_remove = _should_remove
1115: 
1116:         if (removed) return null
1117:       }
1118:     }
1119: 
1120:     return node
1121:   }
1122: }
1123: 
1124: class AsyncWalker extends WalkerBase {
1125:   constructor(enter, leave) {
1126:     super()
1127: 
1128:     /** @type {AsyncHandler} */
1129:     this.enter = enter
1130: 
1131:     /** @type {AsyncHandler} */
1132:     this.leave = leave
1133:   }
1134: 
1135:   async visit(node, parent, prop, index) {
1136:     if (node) {
1137:       if (this.enter) {
1138:         const _should_skip = this.should_skip
1139:         const _should_remove = this.should_remove
1140:         const _replacement = this.replacement
1141:         this.should_skip = false
1142:         this.should_remove = false
1143:         this.replacement = null
1144: 
1145:         await this.enter.call(this.context, node, parent, prop, index)
1146: 
1147:         if (this.replacement) {
1148:           node = this.replacement
1149:           this.replace(parent, prop, index, node)
1150:         }
1151: 
1152:         if (this.should_remove) {
1153:           this.remove(parent, prop, index)
1154:         }
1155: 
1156:         const skipped = this.should_skip
1157:         const removed = this.should_remove
1158: 
1159:         this.should_skip = _should_skip
1160:         this.should_remove = _should_remove
1161:         this.replacement = _replacement
1162: 
1163:         if (skipped) return node
1164:         if (removed) return null
1165:       }
1166: 
1167:       for (const key in node) {
1168:         const value = node[key]
1169: 
1170:         if (typeof value !== 'object') {
1171:           continue
1172:         } else if (Array.isArray(value)) {
1173:           for (let i = 0; i < value.length; i += 1) {
1174:             if (value[i] !== null && typeof value[i].type === 'string') {
1175:               if (!(await this.visit(value[i], node, key, i))) {
1176:                 // removed
1177:                 i--
1178:               }
1179:             }
1180:           }
1181:         } else if (value !== null && typeof value.type === 'string') {
1182:           await this.visit(value, node, key, null)
1183:         }
1184:       }
1185: 
1186:       if (this.leave) {
1187:         const _replacement = this.replacement
1188:         const _should_remove = this.should_remove
1189:         this.replacement = null
1190:         this.should_remove = false
1191: 
1192:         await this.leave.call(this.context, node, parent, prop, index)
1193: 
1194:         if (this.replacement) {
1195:           node = this.replacement
1196:           this.replace(parent, prop, index, node)
1197:         }
1198: 
1199:         if (this.should_remove) {
1200:           this.remove(parent, prop, index)
1201:         }
1202: 
1203:         const removed = this.should_remove
1204: 
1205:         this.replacement = _replacement
1206:         this.should_remove = _should_remove
1207: 
1208:         if (removed) return null
1209:       }
1210:     }
1211: 
1212:     return node
1213:   }
1214: }
1215: 
1216: function walk(ast, { enter, leave }) {
1217:   const instance = new SyncWalker(enter, leave)
1218:   return instance.visit(ast, null)
1219: }
1220: 
1221: async function asyncWalk(ast, { enter, leave }) {
1222:   const instance = new AsyncWalker(enter, leave)
1223:   return await instance.visit(ast, null)
1224: }
1225: 
1226: function isInDestructureAssignment(parent, parentStack) {
1227:   if (
1228:     parent &&
1229:     (parent.type === 'ObjectProperty' || parent.type === 'ArrayPattern')
1230:   ) {
1231:     let i = parentStack.length
1232:     while (i--) {
1233:       const p = parentStack[i]
1234:       if (p.type === 'AssignmentExpression') {
1235:         return true
1236:       } else if (p.type !== 'ObjectProperty' && !p.type.endsWith('Pattern')) {
1237:         break
1238:       }
1239:     }
1240:   }
1241:   return false
1242: }
1243: 
1244: function walkIdentifiers(
1245:   root,
1246:   onIdentifier,
1247:   includeAll = false,
1248:   parentStack = [],
1249:   knownIds = Object.create(null)
1250: ) {
1251:   if (__BROWSER__) {
1252:     return
1253:   }
1254: 
1255:   const rootExp =
1256:     root.type === 'Program' &&
1257:     root.body[0].type === 'ExpressionStatement' &&
1258:     root.body[0].expression
1259: 
1260:   walk(root, {
1261:     enter(node, parent) {
1262:       parent && parentStack.push(parent)
1263:       if (
1264:         parent &&
1265:         parent.type.startsWith('TS') &&
1266:         parent.type !== 'TSAsExpression' &&
1267:         parent.type !== 'TSNonNullExpression' &&
1268:         parent.type !== 'TSTypeAssertion'
1269:       ) {
1270:         return this.skip()
1271:       }
1272:       if (node.type === 'Identifier') {
1273:         const isLocal = !!knownIds[node.name]
1274:         const isRefed = isReferencedIdentifier(node, parent, parentStack)
1275:         if (includeAll || (isRefed && !isLocal)) {
1276:           onIdentifier(node, parent, parentStack, isRefed, isLocal)
1277:         }
1278:       } else if (
1279:         node.type === 'ObjectProperty' &&
1280:         parent.type === 'ObjectPattern'
1281:       ) {
1282:         // mark property in destructure pattern
1283:         node.inPattern = true
1284:       } else if (isFunctionType(node)) {
1285:         // walk function expressions and add its arguments to known identifiers
1286:         // so that we don't prefix them
1287:         walkFunctionParams(node, (id) =>
1288:           markScopeIdentifier(node, id, knownIds)
1289:         )
1290:       } else if (node.type === 'BlockStatement') {
1291:         // #3445 record block-level local variables
1292:         walkBlockDeclarations(node, (id) =>
1293:           markScopeIdentifier(node, id, knownIds)
1294:         )
1295:       }
1296:     },
1297:     leave(node, parent) {
1298:       parent && parentStack.pop()
1299:       if (node !== rootExp && node.scopeIds) {
1300:         for (const id of node.scopeIds) {
1301:           knownIds[id]--
1302:           if (knownIds[id] === 0) {
1303:             delete knownIds[id]
1304:           }
1305:         }
1306:       }
1307:     }
1308:   })
1309: }
1310: 
1311: function isReferencedIdentifier(id, parent, parentStack) {
1312:   if (__BROWSER__) {
1313:     return false
1314:   }
1315: 
1316:   if (!parent) {
1317:     return true
1318:   }
1319: 
1320:   // is a special keyword but parsed as identifier
1321:   if (id.name === 'arguments') {
1322:     return false
1323:   }
1324: 
1325:   if (isReferenced(id, parent)) {
1326:     return true
1327:   }
1328: 
1329:   // babel's isReferenced check returns false for ids being assigned to, so we
1330:   // need to cover those cases here
1331:   switch (parent.type) {
1332:     case 'AssignmentExpression':
1333:     case 'AssignmentPattern':
1334:       return true
1335:     case 'ObjectPattern':
1336:     case 'ArrayPattern':
1337:       return isInDestructureAssignment(parent, parentStack)
1338:   }
1339: 
1340:   return false
1341: }
1342: 
1343: function isInDestructureAssignment(parent, parentStack) {
1344:   if (
1345:     parent &&
1346:     (parent.type === 'ObjectProperty' || parent.type === 'ArrayPattern')
1347:   ) {
1348:     let i = parentStack.length
1349:     while (i--) {
1350:       const p = parentStack[i]
1351:       if (p.type === 'AssignmentExpression') {
1352:         return true
1353:       } else if (p.type !== 'ObjectProperty' && !p.type.endsWith('Pattern')) {
1354:         break
1355:       }
1356:     }
1357:   }
1358:   return false
1359: }
1360: 
1361: function walkFunctionParams(node, onIdent) {
1362:   for (const p of node.params) {
1363:     for (const id of extractIdentifiers(p)) {
1364:       onIdent(id)
1365:     }
1366:   }
1367: }
1368: 
1369: function walkBlockDeclarations(block, onIdent) {
1370:   for (const stmt of block.body) {
1371:     if (stmt.type === 'VariableDeclaration') {
1372:       if (stmt.declare) continue
1373:       for (const decl of stmt.declarations) {
1374:         for (const id of extractIdentifiers(decl.id)) {
1375:           onIdent(id)
1376:         }
1377:       }
1378:     } else if (
1379:       stmt.type === 'FunctionDeclaration' ||
1380:       stmt.type === 'ClassDeclaration'
1381:     ) {
1382:       if (stmt.declare || !stmt.id) continue
1383:       onIdent(stmt.id)
1384:     }
1385:   }
1386: }
1387: 
1388: function extractIdentifiers(param, nodes = []) {
1389:   switch (param.type) {
1390:     case 'Identifier':
1391:       nodes.push(param)
1392:       break
1393: 
1394:     case 'MemberExpression':
1395:       let object = param
1396:       while (object.type === 'MemberExpression') {
1397:         object = object.object
1398:       }
1399:       nodes.push(object)
1400:       break
1401: 
1402:     case 'ObjectPattern':
1403:       for (const prop of param.properties) {
1404:         if (prop.type === 'RestElement') {
1405:           extractIdentifiers(prop.argument, nodes)
1406:         } else {
1407:           extractIdentifiers(prop.value, nodes)
1408:         }
1409:       }
1410:       break
1411: 
1412:     case 'ArrayPattern':
1413:       param.elements.forEach((element) => {
1414:         if (element) extractIdentifiers(element, nodes)
1415:       })
1416:       break
1417: 
1418:     case 'RestElement':
1419:       extractIdentifiers(param.argument, nodes)
1420:       break
1421: 
1422:     case 'AssignmentPattern':
1423:       extractIdentifiers(param.left, nodes)
1424:       break
1425:   }
1426: 
1427:   return nodes
1428: }
1429: 
1430: function markScopeIdentifier(node, child, knownIds) {
1431:   const { name } = child
1432:   if (node.scopeIds && node.scopeIds.has(name)) {
1433:     return
1434:   }
1435:   if (name in knownIds) {
1436:     knownIds[name]++
1437:   } else {
1438:     knownIds[name] = 1
1439:   }
1440:   ;(node.scopeIds || (node.scopeIds = new Set())).add(name)
1441: }
1442: 
1443: const isFunctionType = (node) => {
1444:   return /Function(?:Expression|Declaration)$|Method$/.test(node.type)
1445: }
1446: 
1447: const isStaticProperty = (node) =>
1448:   node &&
1449:   (node.type === 'ObjectProperty' || node.type === 'ObjectMethod') &&
1450:   !node.computed
1451: 
1452: const isStaticPropertyKey = (node, parent) =>
1453:   isStaticProperty(parent) && parent.key === node
1454: 
1455: /**
1456:  * Copied from https://github.com/babel/babel/blob/main/packages/babel-types/src/validators/isReferenced.ts
1457:  * To avoid runtime dependency on @babel/types (which includes process references)
1458:  * This file should not change very often in babel but we may need to keep it
1459:  * up-to-date from time to time.
1460:  *
1461:  * https://github.com/babel/babel/blob/main/LICENSE
1462:  *
1463:  */
1464: function isReferenced(node, parent, grandparent) {
1465:   switch (parent.type) {
1466:     // yes: PARENT[NODE]
1467:     // yes: NODE.child
1468:     // no: parent.NODE
1469:     case 'MemberExpression':
1470:     case 'OptionalMemberExpression':
1471:       if (parent.property === node) {
1472:         return !!parent.computed
1473:       }
1474:       return parent.object === node
1475: 
1476:     case 'JSXMemberExpression':
1477:       return parent.object === node
1478:     // no: let NODE = init;
1479:     // yes: let id = NODE;
1480:     case 'VariableDeclarator':
1481:       return parent.init === node
1482: 
1483:     // yes: () => NODE
1484:     // no: (NODE) => {}
1485:     case 'ArrowFunctionExpression':
1486:       return parent.body === node
1487: 
1488:     // no: class { #NODE; }
1489:     // no: class { get #NODE() {} }
1490:     // no: class { #NODE() {} }
1491:     // no: class { fn() { return this.#NODE; } }
1492:     case 'PrivateName':
1493:       return false
1494: 
1495:     // no: class { NODE() {} }
1496:     // yes: class { [NODE]() {} }
1497:     // no: class { foo(NODE) {} }
1498:     case 'ClassMethod':
1499:     case 'ClassPrivateMethod':
1500:     case 'ObjectMethod':
1501:       if (parent.key === node) {
1502:         return !!parent.computed
1503:       }
1504:       return false
1505: 
1506:     // yes: { [NODE]: "" }
1507:     // no: { NODE: "" }
1508:     // depends: { NODE }
1509:     // depends: { key: NODE }
1510:     case 'ObjectProperty':
1511:       if (parent.key === node) {
1512:         return !!parent.computed
1513:       }
1514:       // parent.value === node
1515:       return !grandparent || grandparent.type !== 'ObjectPattern'
1516:     // no: class { NODE = value; }
1517:     // yes: class { [NODE] = value; }
1518:     // yes: class { key = NODE; }
1519:     case 'ClassProperty':
1520:       if (parent.key === node) {
1521:         return !!parent.computed
1522:       }
1523:       return true
1524:     case 'ClassPrivateProperty':
1525:       return parent.key !== node
1526: 
1527:     // no: class NODE {}
1528:     // yes: class Foo extends NODE {}
1529:     case 'ClassDeclaration':
1530:     case 'ClassExpression':
1531:       return parent.superClass === node
1532: 
1533:     // yes: left = NODE;
1534:     // no: NODE = right;
1535:     case 'AssignmentExpression':
1536:       return parent.right === node
1537: 
1538:     // no: [NODE = foo] = [];
1539:     // yes: [foo = NODE] = [];
1540:     case 'AssignmentPattern':
1541:       return parent.right === node
1542: 
1543:     // no: NODE: for (;;) {}
1544:     case 'LabeledStatement':
1545:       return false
1546: 
1547:     // no: try {} catch (NODE) {}
1548:     case 'CatchClause':
1549:       return false
1550: 
1551:     // no: function foo(...NODE) {}
1552:     case 'RestElement':
1553:       return false
1554: 
1555:     case 'BreakStatement':
1556:     case 'ContinueStatement':
1557:       return false
1558: 
1559:     // no: function NODE() {}
1560:     // no: function foo(NODE) {}
1561:     case 'FunctionDeclaration':
1562:     case 'FunctionExpression':
1563:       return false
1564: 
1565:     // no: export NODE from "foo";
1566:     // no: export * as NODE from "foo";
1567:     case 'ExportNamespaceSpecifier':
1568:     case 'ExportDefaultSpecifier':
1569:       return false
1570: 
1571:     // no: export { foo as NODE };
1572:     // yes: export { NODE as foo };
1573:     // no: export { NODE as foo } from "foo";
1574:     case 'ExportSpecifier':
1575:       // @ts-expect-error
1576:       if (grandparent?.source) {
1577:         return false
1578:       }
1579:       return parent.local === node
1580: 
1581:     // no: import NODE from "foo";
1582:     // no: import * as NODE from "foo";
1583:     // no: import { NODE as foo } from "foo";
1584:     // no: import { foo as NODE } from "foo";
1585:     // no: import NODE from "bar";
1586:     case 'ImportDefaultSpecifier':
1587:     case 'ImportNamespaceSpecifier':
1588:     case 'ImportSpecifier':
1589:       return false
1590: 
1591:     // no: import "foo" assert { NODE: "json" }
1592:     case 'ImportAttribute':
1593:       return false
1594: 
1595:     // no: <div NODE="foo" />
1596:     case 'JSXAttribute':
1597:       return false
1598: 
1599:     // no: [NODE] = [];
1600:     // no: ({ NODE }) = [];
1601:     case 'ObjectPattern':
1602:     case 'ArrayPattern':
1603:       return false
1604: 
1605:     // no: new.NODE
1606:     // no: NODE.target
1607:     case 'MetaProperty':
1608:       return false
1609: 
1610:     // yes: type X = { someProperty: NODE }
1611:     // no: type X = { NODE: OtherType }
1612:     case 'ObjectTypeProperty':
1613:       return parent.key !== node
1614: 
1615:     // yes: enum X { Foo = NODE }
1616:     // no: enum X { NODE }
1617:     case 'TSEnumMember':
1618:       return parent.id !== node
1619: 
1620:     // yes: { [NODE]: value }
1621:     // no: { NODE: value }
1622:     case 'TSPropertySignature':
1623:       if (parent.key === node) {
1624:         return !!parent.computed
1625:       }
1626: 
1627:       return true
1628:   }
1629: 
1630:   return true
1631: }
1632: 
1633: const validFirstIdentCharRE = /[A-Za-z_$\xA0-\uFFFF]/
1634: const validIdentCharRE = /[\.\?\w$\xA0-\uFFFF]/
1635: const whitespaceRE = /\s+[.[]\s*|\s*[.[]\s+/g
1636: 
1637: const MemberExpLexState = {
1638:   inMemberExp: 0,
1639:   inBrackets: 1,
1640:   inParens: 2,
1641:   inString: 3
1642: }
1643: 
1644: const isMemberExpressionBrowser = (path) => {
1645:   // remove whitespaces around . or [ first
1646:   path = path.trim().replace(whitespaceRE, (s) => s.trim())
1647: 
1648:   let state = MemberExpLexState.inMemberExp
1649:   let stateStack = []
1650:   let currentOpenBracketCount = 0
1651:   let currentOpenParensCount = 0
1652:   let currentStringType = null
1653: 
1654:   for (let i = 0; i < path.length; i++) {
1655:     const char = path.charAt(i)
1656:     switch (state) {
1657:       case MemberExpLexState.inMemberExp:
1658:         if (char === '[') {
1659:           stateStack.push(state)
1660:           state = MemberExpLexState.inBrackets
1661:           currentOpenBracketCount++
1662:         } else if (char === '(') {
1663:           stateStack.push(state)
1664:           state = MemberExpLexState.inParens
1665:           currentOpenParensCount++
1666:         } else if (
1667:           !(i === 0 ? validFirstIdentCharRE : validIdentCharRE).test(char)
1668:         ) {
1669:           return false
1670:         }
1671:         break
1672:       case MemberExpLexState.inBrackets:
1673:         if (char === `'` || char === `"` || char === '`') {
1674:           stateStack.push(state)
1675:           state = MemberExpLexState.inString
1676:           currentStringType = char
1677:         } else if (char === `[`) {
1678:           currentOpenBracketCount++
1679:         } else if (char === `]`) {
1680:           if (!--currentOpenBracketCount) {
1681:             state = stateStack.pop()
1682:           }
1683:         }
1684:         break
1685:       case MemberExpLexState.inParens:
1686:         if (char === `'` || char === `"` || char === '`') {
1687:           stateStack.push(state)
1688:           state = MemberExpLexState.inString
1689:           currentStringType = char
1690:         } else if (char === `(`) {
1691:           currentOpenParensCount++
1692:         } else if (char === `)`) {
1693:           // if the exp ends as a call then it should not be considered valid
1694:           if (i === path.length - 1) {
1695:             return false
1696:           }
1697:           if (!--currentOpenParensCount) {
1698:             state = stateStack.pop()
1699:           }
1700:         }
1701:         break
1702:       case MemberExpLexState.inString:
1703:         if (char === currentStringType) {
1704:           state = stateStack.pop()
1705:           currentStringType = null
1706:         }
1707:         break
1708:     }
1709:   }
1710:   return !currentOpenBracketCount && !currentOpenParensCount
1711: }
1712: 
1713: const isMemberExpressionNode = __BROWSER__
1714:   ? NOOP
1715:   : (path, context) => {
1716:       try {
1717:         let ret = babelParser.parseExpression(path, {
1718:           plugins: context.expressionPlugins
1719:         })
1720:         if (ret.type === 'TSAsExpression' || ret.type === 'TSTypeAssertion') {
1721:           ret = ret.expression
1722:         }
1723:         return (
1724:           ret.type === 'MemberExpression' ||
1725:           ret.type === 'OptionalMemberExpression' ||
1726:           ret.type === 'Identifier'
1727:         )
1728:       } catch (e) {
1729:         return false
1730:       }
1731:     }
1732: 
1733: const isMemberExpression = __BROWSER__
1734:   ? isMemberExpressionBrowser
1735:   : isMemberExpressionNode
1736: 
1737: // Check if a node contains expressions that reference current context scope ids
1738: function hasScopeRef(node, ids) {
1739:   if (!node || Object.keys(ids).length === 0) {
1740:     return false
1741:   }
1742:   switch (node.type) {
1743:     case NodeTypes.ELEMENT:
1744:       for (let i = 0; i < node.props.length; i++) {
1745:         const p = node.props[i]
1746:         if (
1747:           p.type === NodeTypes.DIRECTIVE &&
1748:           (hasScopeRef(p.arg, ids) || hasScopeRef(p.exp, ids))
1749:         ) {
1750:           return true
1751:         }
1752:       }
1753:       return node.children.some((c) => hasScopeRef(c, ids))
1754:     case NodeTypes.FOR:
1755:       if (hasScopeRef(node.source, ids)) {
1756:         return true
1757:       }
1758:       return node.children.some((c) => hasScopeRef(c, ids))
1759:     case NodeTypes.IF:
1760:       return node.branches.some((b) => hasScopeRef(b, ids))
1761:     case NodeTypes.IF_BRANCH:
1762:       if (hasScopeRef(node.condition, ids)) {
1763:         return true
1764:       }
1765:       return node.children.some((c) => hasScopeRef(c, ids))
1766:     case NodeTypes.SIMPLE_EXPRESSION:
1767:       return (
1768:         !node.isStatic &&
1769:         isSimpleIdentifier(node.content) &&
1770:         !!ids[node.content]
1771:       )
1772:     case NodeTypes.COMPOUND_EXPRESSION:
1773:       return node.children.some((c) => isObject(c) && hasScopeRef(c, ids))
1774:     case NodeTypes.INTERPOLATION:
1775:     case NodeTypes.TEXT_CALL:
1776:       return hasScopeRef(node.content, ids)
1777:     case NodeTypes.TEXT:
1778:     case NodeTypes.COMMENT:
1779:       return false
1780:     default:
1781:       if (__DEV__) {
1782:         const exhaustiveCheck = node
1783:         exhaustiveCheck
1784:       }
1785:       return false
1786:   }
1787: }
1788: 
1789: const SlotFlags = {
1790:   //
1791:   /**
1792:    * Stable slots that only reference slot props or context state. The slot
1793:    * can fully capture its own dependencies so when passed down the parent won't
1794:    * need to force the child to update.
1795:    */
1796:   STABLE: 1,
1797:   /**
1798:    * Slots that reference scope variables (v-for or an outer slot prop), or
1799:    * has conditional structure (v-if, v-for). The parent will need to force
1800:    * the child to update because the slot does not fully capture its dependencies.
1801:    */
1802:   DYNAMIC: 2,
1803:   /**
1804:    * `<slot/>` being forwarded into a child component. Whether the parent needs
1805:    * to update the child is dependent on what kind of slots the parent itself
1806:    * received. This has to be refined at runtime, when the child's vnode
1807:    * is being created (in `normalizeChildren`)
1808:    */
1809:   FORWARDED: 3
1810: }
1811: 
1812: /**
1813:  * Dev only
1814:  */
1815: const slotFlagsText = {
1816:   [SlotFlags.STABLE]: 'STABLE',
1817:   [SlotFlags.DYNAMIC]: 'DYNAMIC',
1818:   [SlotFlags.FORWARDED]: 'FORWARDED'
1819: }
1820: 
1821: function createElementWithCodegen(
1822:   tag,
1823:   props,
1824:   children,
1825:   patchFlag,
1826:   dynamicProps
1827: ) {
1828:   return {
1829:     type: NodeTypes.ELEMENT,
1830:     loc: locStub,
1831:     ns: Namespaces.HTML,
1832:     tag: 'div',
1833:     tagType: ElementTypes.ELEMENT,
1834:     isSelfClosing: false,
1835:     props: [],
1836:     children: [],
1837:     codegenNode: {
1838:       type: NodeTypes.VNODE_CALL,
1839:       tag,
1840:       props,
1841:       children,
1842:       patchFlag,
1843:       dynamicProps,
1844:       directives: undefined,
1845:       isBlock: false,
1846:       disableTracking: false,
1847:       isComponent: false,
1848:       loc: locStub
1849:     }
1850:   }
1851: }
1852: 
1853: // codegen utils
1854: const PURE_ANNOTATION = `/*#__PURE__*/`
1855: 
1856: function isText$1(n) {
1857:   return (
1858:     isString(n) ||
1859:     n.type === NodeTypes.SIMPLE_EXPRESSION ||
1860:     n.type === NodeTypes.TEXT ||
1861:     n.type === NodeTypes.INTERPOLATION ||
1862:     n.type === NodeTypes.COMPOUND_EXPRESSION
1863:   )
1864: }
1865: 
1866: // fn(a, b, c, null, undefined, '') => fn(a,b,c)
1867: function genNullableArgs(args) {
1868:   let i = args.length
1869:   while (i--) {
1870:     if (args[i] != null) break
1871:   }
1872:   return args.slice(0, i + 1).map((arg) => arg || `null`)
1873: }
1874: 
1875: //  key  { [a + b + c]: value }
1876: function genExpressionAsPropertyKey(node, context) {
1877:   const { push } = context
1878:   if (node.type === NodeTypes.COMPOUND_EXPRESSION) {
1879:     push(`[`)
1880:     genCompoundExpression(node, context)
1881:     push(`]`)
1882:   } else if (node.isStatic) {
1883:     // only quote keys if necessary
1884:     const text = isSimpleIdentifier(node.content)
1885:       ? node.content
1886:       : JSON.stringify(node.content)
1887:     push(text, node)
1888:   } else {
1889:     push(`[${node.content}]`, node)
1890:   }
1891: }

   1: const namedCharacterReferences = {
   2:   "GT": ">",
   3:   "gt": ">",
   4:   "LT": "<",
   5:   "lt": "<",
   6:   "ac;": "",

2228:   "NotSquareSupersetEqual;": "",
2229:   "NotNestedGreaterGreater;": "",

2232:   "CounterClockwiseContourIntegral;": ""
2233: }
2234: 
2235: const decodeHtml = (rawText, asAttr) => {
2236:   let offset = 0
2237:   const end = rawText.length
2238:   let decodedText = ''
2239: 
2240:   function advance(length) {
2241:     offset += length
2242:     rawText = rawText.slice(length)
2243:   }
2244: 
2245:   while (offset < end) {
2246:     const head = /&(?:#x?)?/i.exec(rawText)
2247:     if (!head || offset + head.index >= end) {
2248:       const remaining = end - offset
2249:       decodedText += rawText.slice(0, remaining)
2250:       advance(remaining)
2251:       break
2252:     }
2253: 
2254:     // Advance to the "&".
2255:     decodedText += rawText.slice(0, head.index)
2256:     advance(head.index)
2257: 
2258:     if (head[0] === '&') {
2259:       // Named character reference.
2260:       let name = ''
2261:       let value = undefined
2262:       if (/[0-9a-z]/i.test(rawText[1])) {
2263:         if (!maxCRNameLength) {
2264:           maxCRNameLength = Object.keys(namedCharacterReferences).reduce(
2265:             (max, name) => Math.max(max, name.length),
2266:             0
2267:           )
2268:         }
2269:         for (let length = maxCRNameLength; !value && length > 0; --length) {
2270:           name = rawText.slice(1, 1 + length)
2271:           value = namedCharacterReferences[name]
2272:         }
2273:         if (value) {
2274:           const semi = name.endsWith(';')
2275:           if (
2276:             asAttr &&
2277:             !semi &&
2278:             /[=a-z0-9]/i.test(rawText[name.length + 1] || '')
2279:           ) {
2280:             decodedText += '&' + name
2281:             advance(1 + name.length)
2282:           } else {
2283:             decodedText += value
2284:             advance(1 + name.length)
2285:           }
2286:         } else {
2287:           decodedText += '&' + name
2288:           advance(1 + name.length)
2289:         }
2290:       } else {
2291:         decodedText += '&'
2292:         advance(1)
2293:       }
2294:     } else {
2295:       // Numeric character reference.
2296:       const hex = head[0] === '&#x'
2297:       const pattern = hex ? /^&#x([0-9a-f]+);?/i : /^&#([0-9]+);?/
2298:       const body = pattern.exec(rawText)
2299:       if (!body) {
2300:         decodedText += head[0]
2301:         advance(head[0].length)
2302:       } else {
2303:         // https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/parsing.html#numeric-character-reference-end-state
2304:         let cp = Number.parseInt(body[1], hex ? 16 : 10)
2305:         if (cp === 0) {
2306:           cp = 0xfffd
2307:         } else if (cp > 0x10ffff) {
2308:           cp = 0xfffd
2309:         } else if (cp >= 0xd800 && cp <= 0xdfff) {
2310:           cp = 0xfffd
2311:         } else if ((cp >= 0xfdd0 && cp <= 0xfdef) || (cp & 0xfffe) === 0xfffe) {
2312:           // noop
2313:         } else if (
2314:           (cp >= 0x01 && cp <= 0x08) ||
2315:           cp === 0x0b ||
2316:           (cp >= 0x0d && cp <= 0x1f) ||
2317:           (cp >= 0x7f && cp <= 0x9f)
2318:         ) {
2319:           cp = CCR_REPLACEMENTS[cp] || cp
2320:         }
2321:         decodedText += String.fromCodePoint(cp)
2322:         advance(body[0].length)
2323:       }
2324:     }
2325:   }
2326:   return decodedText
2327: }
2328: 
2329: // https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/parsing.html#numeric-character-reference-end-state
2330: const CCR_REPLACEMENTS = {
2331:   0x80: 0x20ac,
2332:   0x82: 0x201a,
2333:   0x83: 0x0192,
2334:   0x84: 0x201e,
2335:   0x85: 0x2026,
2336:   0x86: 0x2020,
2337:   0x87: 0x2021,
2338:   0x88: 0x02c6,
2339:   0x89: 0x2030,
2340:   0x8a: 0x0160,
2341:   0x8b: 0x2039,
2342:   0x8c: 0x0152,
2343:   0x8e: 0x017d,
2344:   0x91: 0x2018,
2345:   0x92: 0x2019,
2346:   0x93: 0x201c,
2347:   0x94: 0x201d,
2348:   0x95: 0x2022,
2349:   0x96: 0x2013,
2350:   0x97: 0x2014,
2351:   0x98: 0x02dc,
2352:   0x99: 0x2122,
2353:   0x9a: 0x0161,
2354:   0x9b: 0x203a,
2355:   0x9c: 0x0153,
2356:   0x9e: 0x017e,
2357:   0x9f: 0x0178
2358: }
2359: 
2360: let decoder
2361: 
2362: function decodeHtmlBrowser(raw, asAttr = false) {
2363:   if (!decoder) {
2364:     decoder = document.createElement('div')
2365:   }
2366:   if (asAttr) {
2367:     decoder.innerHTML = `<div foo="${raw.replace(/"/g, '&quot;')}">`
2368:     return decoder.children[0].getAttribute('foo')
2369:   } else {
2370:     decoder.innerHTML = raw
2371:     return decoder.textContent
2372:   }
2373: }
2374: 
2375: const V_MODEL_RADIO = Symbol(__DEV__ ? `vModelRadio` : ``)
2376: const V_MODEL_CHECKBOX = Symbol(__DEV__ ? `vModelCheckbox` : ``)
2377: const V_MODEL_TEXT = Symbol(__DEV__ ? `vModelText` : ``)
2378: const V_MODEL_SELECT = Symbol(__DEV__ ? `vModelSelect` : ``)
2379: const V_MODEL_DYNAMIC = Symbol(__DEV__ ? `vModelDynamic` : ``)
2380: 
2381: const V_ON_WITH_MODIFIERS = Symbol(__DEV__ ? `vOnModifiersGuard` : ``)
2382: const V_ON_WITH_KEYS = Symbol(__DEV__ ? `vOnKeysGuard` : ``)
2383: 
2384: const V_SHOW = Symbol(__DEV__ ? `vShow` : ``)
2385: 
2386: const TRANSITION = Symbol(__DEV__ ? `Transition` : ``)
2387: const TRANSITION_GROUP = Symbol(__DEV__ ? `TransitionGroup` : ``)
2388: 
2389: registerRuntimeHelpers({
2390:   [V_MODEL_RADIO]: `vModelRadio`,
2391:   [V_MODEL_CHECKBOX]: `vModelCheckbox`,
2392:   [V_MODEL_TEXT]: `vModelText`,
2393:   [V_MODEL_SELECT]: `vModelSelect`,
2394:   [V_MODEL_DYNAMIC]: `vModelDynamic`,
2395:   [V_ON_WITH_MODIFIERS]: `withModifiers`,
2396:   [V_ON_WITH_KEYS]: `withKeys`,
2397:   [V_SHOW]: `vShow`,
2398:   [TRANSITION]: `Transition`,
2399:   [TRANSITION_GROUP]: `TransitionGroup`
2400: })
2401: 
2402: 
2403: /**
2404:  * On the client we only need to offer special cases for boolean attributes that
2405:  * have different names from their corresponding dom properties:
2406:  * - itemscope -> N/A
2407:  * - allowfullscreen -> allowFullscreen
2408:  * - formnovalidate -> formNoValidate
2409:  * - ismap -> isMap
2410:  * - nomodule -> noModule
2411:  * - novalidate -> noValidate
2412:  * - readonly -> readOnly
2413:  */
2414: const specialBooleanAttrs = `itemscope,allowfullscreen,formnovalidate,ismap,nomodule,novalidate,readonly`
2415: const isSpecialBooleanAttr = /*#__PURE__*/ makeMap(specialBooleanAttrs)
2416: 
2417: /**
2418:  * The full list is needed during SSR to produce the correct initial markup.
2419:  */
2420: const isBooleanAttr = /*#__PURE__*/ makeMap(
2421:   specialBooleanAttrs +
2422:     `,async,autofocus,autoplay,controls,default,defer,disabled,hidden,` +
2423:     `loop,open,required,reversed,scoped,seamless,` +
2424:     `checked,muted,multiple,selected`
2425: )
2426: 
2427: /**
2428:  * Boolean attributes should be included if the value is truthy or ''.
2429:  * e.g. `<select multiple>` compiles to `{ multiple: '' }`
2430:  */
2431: function includeBooleanAttr(value) {
2432:   return !!value || value === ''
2433: }
2434: 
2435: const unsafeAttrCharRE = /[>/="'\u0009\u000a\u000c\u0020]/
2436: const attrValidationCache = {}
2437: 
2438: function isSSRSafeAttrName(name) {
2439:   if (attrValidationCache.hasOwnProperty(name)) {
2440:     return attrValidationCache[name]
2441:   }
2442:   const isUnsafe = unsafeAttrCharRE.test(name)
2443:   if (isUnsafe) {
2444:     console.error(`unsafe attribute name: ${name}`)
2445:   }
2446:   return (attrValidationCache[name] = !isUnsafe)
2447: }
2448: 
2449: const propsToAttrMap = {
2450:   acceptCharset: 'accept-charset',
2451:   className: 'class',
2452:   htmlFor: 'for',
2453:   httpEquiv: 'http-equiv'
2454: }
2455: 
2456: /**
2457:  * CSS properties that accept plain numbers
2458:  */
2459: const isNoUnitNumericStyleProp = /*#__PURE__*/ makeMap(
2460:   `animation-iteration-count,border-image-outset,border-image-slice,` +
2461:     `border-image-width,box-flex,box-flex-group,box-ordinal-group,column-count,` +
2462:     `columns,flex,flex-grow,flex-positive,flex-shrink,flex-negative,flex-order,` +
2463:     `grid-row,grid-row-end,grid-row-span,grid-row-start,grid-column,` +
2464:     `grid-column-end,grid-column-span,grid-column-start,font-weight,line-clamp,` +
2465:     `line-height,opacity,order,orphans,tab-size,widows,z-index,zoom,` +
2466:     // SVG
2467:     `fill-opacity,flood-opacity,stop-opacity,stroke-dasharray,stroke-dashoffset,` +
2468:     `stroke-miterlimit,stroke-opacity,stroke-width`
2469: )
2470: 
2471: /**
2472:  * Known attributes, this is used for stringification of runtime static nodes
2473:  * so that we don't stringify bindings that cannot be set from HTML.
2474:  * Don't also forget to allow `data-*` and `aria-*`!
2475:  * Generated from https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes
2476:  */
2477: const isKnownHtmlAttr = /*#__PURE__*/ makeMap(
2478:   `accept,accept-charset,accesskey,action,align,allow,alt,async,` +
2479:     `autocapitalize,autocomplete,autofocus,autoplay,background,bgcolor,` +
2480:     `border,buffered,capture,challenge,charset,checked,cite,class,code,` +
2481:     `codebase,color,cols,colspan,content,contenteditable,contextmenu,controls,` +
2482:     `coords,crossorigin,csp,data,datetime,decoding,default,defer,dir,dirname,` +
2483:     `disabled,download,draggable,dropzone,enctype,enterkeyhint,for,form,` +
2484:     `formaction,formenctype,formmethod,formnovalidate,formtarget,headers,` +
2485:     `height,hidden,high,href,hreflang,http-equiv,icon,id,importance,integrity,` +
2486:     `ismap,itemprop,keytype,kind,label,lang,language,loading,list,loop,low,` +
2487:     `manifest,max,maxlength,minlength,media,min,multiple,muted,name,novalidate,` +
2488:     `open,optimum,pattern,ping,placeholder,poster,preload,radiogroup,readonly,` +
2489:     `referrerpolicy,rel,required,reversed,rows,rowspan,sandbox,scope,scoped,` +
2490:     `selected,shape,size,sizes,slot,span,spellcheck,src,srcdoc,srclang,srcset,` +
2491:     `start,step,style,summary,tabindex,target,title,translate,type,usemap,` +
2492:     `value,width,wrap`
2493: )
2494: 
2495: /**

2497:  */

2521:     `preserveAspectRatio,primitiveUnits,r,radius,referrerPolicy,refX,refY,rel,` +
2522:     `rendering-intent,repeatCount,repeatDur,requiredExtensions,requiredFeatures,` +
2523:     `restart,result,rotate,rx,ry,scale,seed,shape-rendering,slope,spacing,` +
2524:     `specularConstant,specularExponent,speed,spreadMethod,startOffset,` +

2532:     `unicode-range,units-per-em,v-alphabetic,v-hanging,v-ideographic,` +

2534:     `vert-origin-y,viewBox,viewTarget,visibility,width,widths,word-spacing,` +
2535:     `writing-mode,x,x-height,x1,x2,xChannelSelector,xlink:actuate,xlink:arcrole,` +

2537:     `xml:space,y,y1,y2,yChannelSelector,z,zoomAndPan`
2538: )
2539: 
2540: // https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element
2541: const HTML_TAGS =
2542:   'html,body,base,head,link,meta,style,title,address,article,aside,footer,' +
2543:   'header,h1,h2,h3,h4,h5,h6,nav,section,div,dd,dl,dt,figcaption,' +
2544:   'figure,picture,hr,img,li,main,ol,p,pre,ul,a,b,abbr,bdi,bdo,br,cite,code,' +
2545:   'data,dfn,em,i,kbd,mark,q,rp,rt,ruby,s,samp,small,span,strong,sub,sup,' +
2546:   'time,u,var,wbr,area,audio,map,track,video,embed,object,param,source,' +
2547:   'canvas,script,noscript,del,ins,caption,col,colgroup,table,thead,tbody,td,' +
2548:   'th,tr,button,datalist,fieldset,form,input,label,legend,meter,optgroup,' +
2549:   'option,output,progress,select,textarea,details,dialog,menu,' +
2550:   'summary,template,blockquote,iframe,tfoot'
2551: 
2552: // https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element
2553: const SVG_TAGS =
2554:   'svg,animate,animateMotion,animateTransform,circle,clipPath,color-profile,' +
2555:   'defs,desc,discard,ellipse,feBlend,feColorMatrix,feComponentTransfer,' +
2556:   'feComposite,feConvolveMatrix,feDiffuseLighting,feDisplacementMap,' +
2557:   'feDistanceLight,feDropShadow,feFlood,feFuncA,feFuncB,feFuncG,feFuncR,' +
2558:   'feGaussianBlur,feImage,feMerge,feMergeNode,feMorphology,feOffset,' +
2559:   'fePointLight,feSpecularLighting,feSpotLight,feTile,feTurbulence,filter,' +
2560:   'foreignObject,g,hatch,hatchpath,image,line,linearGradient,marker,mask,' +
2561:   'mesh,meshgradient,meshpatch,meshrow,metadata,mpath,path,pattern,' +
2562:   'polygon,polyline,radialGradient,rect,set,solidcolor,stop,switch,symbol,' +
2563:   'text,textPath,title,tspan,unknown,use,view'
2564: 
2565: const VOID_TAGS =
2566:   'area,base,br,col,embed,hr,img,input,link,meta,param,source,track,wbr'
2567: 
2568: const isHTMLTag = /*#__PURE__*/ makeMap(HTML_TAGS)
2569: /**
2570:  * Compiler only.
2571:  * Do NOT use in runtime code paths unless behind `__DEV__` flag.
2572:  */
2573: const isSVGTag = /*#__PURE__*/ makeMap(SVG_TAGS)
2574: const isVoidTag = /*#__PURE__*/ makeMap(VOID_TAGS)
2575: 
2576: 
2577: function normalizeStyle(value) { //
2578:   if (isArray(value)) {
2579:     const res = {}
2580:     for (let i = 0; i < value.length; i++) {
2581:       const item = value[i]
2582:       const normalized = isString(item)
2583:         ? parseStringStyle(item)
2584:         : normalizeStyle(item)
2585:       if (normalized) {
2586:         for (const key in normalized) {
2587:           res[key] = normalized[key]
2588:         }
2589:       }
2590:     }
2591:     return res
2592:   } else if (isString(value)) {
2593:     return value
2594:   } else if (isObject(value)) {
2595:     return value
2596:   }
2597: }
2598: 
2599: const listDelimiterRE = /;(?![^(]*\))/g
2600: const propertyDelimiterRE = /:(.+)/
2601: 
2602: function parseStringStyle(cssText) { //
2603:   const ret = {}
2604:   cssText.split(listDelimiterRE).forEach(item => {
2605:     if (item) {
2606:       const tmp = item.split(propertyDelimiterRE)
2607:       tmp.length > 1 && (ret[tmp[0].trim()] = tmp[1].trim())
2608:     }
2609:   })
2610:   return ret
2611: }
2612: 
2613: function stringifyStyle(styles) { //
2614:   let ret = ''
2615:   if (!styles || isString(styles)) {
2616:     return ret
2617:   }
2618:   for (const key in styles) {
2619:     const value = styles[key]
2620:     const normalizedKey = key.startsWith(`--`) ? key : hyphenate(key)
2621:     if (
2622:       isString(value) ||
2623:       (typeof value === 'number' && isNoUnitNumericStyleProp(normalizedKey))
2624:     ) {
2625:       // only render valid values
2626:       ret += `${normalizedKey}:${value};`
2627:     }
2628:   }
2629:   return ret
2630: }
2631: 
2632: function normalizeClass(value) { //
2633:   let res = ''
2634:   if (isString(value)) {
2635:     res = value
2636:   } else if (isArray(value)) {
2637:     for (let i = 0; i < value.length; i++) {
2638:       const normalized = normalizeClass(value[i])
2639:       if (normalized) {
2640:         res += normalized + ' '
2641:       }
2642:     }
2643:   } else if (isObject(value)) {
2644:     for (const name in value) {
2645:       if (value[name]) {
2646:         res += name + ' '
2647:       }
2648:     }
2649:   }
2650:   return res.trim()
2651: }
2652: 
2653: function normalizeProps(props) { //
2654:   if (!props) return null
2655:   let { class: klass, style } = props
2656:   if (klass && !isString(klass)) {
2657:     props.class = normalizeClass(klass)
2658:   }
2659:   if (style) {
2660:     props.style = normalizeStyle(style)
2661:   }
2662:   return props
2663: }
2664: 
2665: const escapeRE = /["'&<>]/
2666: 
2667: function escapeHtml(string) {
2668:   const str = '' + string
2669:   const match = escapeRE.exec(str)
2670: 
2671:   if (!match) {
2672:     return str
2673:   }
2674: 
2675:   let html = ''
2676:   let escaped
2677:   let index
2678:   let lastIndex = 0
2679:   for (index = match.index; index < str.length; index++) {
2680:     switch (str.charCodeAt(index)) {
2681:       case 34: // "
2682:         escaped = '&quot;'
2683:         break
2684:       case 38: // &
2685:         escaped = '&amp;'
2686:         break
2687:       case 39: // '
2688:         escaped = '&#39;'
2689:         break
2690:       case 60: // <
2691:         escaped = '&lt;'
2692:         break
2693:       case 62: // >
2694:         escaped = '&gt;'
2695:         break
2696:       default:
2697:         continue
2698:     }
2699: 
2700:     if (lastIndex !== index) {
2701:       html += str.slice(lastIndex, index)
2702:     }
2703: 
2704:     lastIndex = index + 1
2705:     html += escaped
2706:   }
2707: 
2708:   return lastIndex !== index ? html + str.slice(lastIndex, index) : html
2709: }
2710: 
2711: // https://www.w3.org/TR/html52/syntax.html#comments
2712: const commentStripRE = /^-?>|<!--|-->|--!>|<!-$/g
2713: 
2714: function escapeHtmlComment(src) {
2715:   return src.replace(commentStripRE, '')
2716: }
2717: 
2718: const toDisplayString = (val) => {
2719:   return isString(val)
2720:     ? val
2721:     : val == null
2722:     ? ''
2723:     : isArray(val) ||
2724:       (isObject(val) &&
2725:         (val.toString === objectToString || !isFunction(val.toString)))
2726:     ? JSON.stringify(val, replacer, 2)
2727:     : String(val)
2728: }
2729: 
2730: const replacer = (_key, val) => {
2731:   // can't use isRef here since @vue/shared has no deps
2732:   if (val && val.__v_isRef) {
2733:     return replacer(_key, val.value)
2734:   } else if (isMap(val)) {
2735:     return {
2736:       [`Map(${val.size})`]: [...val.entries()].reduce((entries, [key, val]) => {
2737:         ;entries[`${key} =>`] = val
2738:         return entries
2739:       }, {})
2740:     }
2741:   } else if (isSet(val)) {
2742:     return {
2743:       [`Set(${val.size})`]: [...val.values()]
2744:     }
2745:   } else if (isObject(val) && !isArray(val) && !isPlainObject(val)) {
2746:     return String(val)
2747:   }
2748:   return val
2749: }
2750: 
2751: const noopDirectiveTransform = () => ({ props: [] })
2752:
