 773:     }
 774:   } else if (
 775:     node.type === 'TSEnumDeclaration' ||
 776:     node.type === 'FunctionDeclaration' ||
 777:     node.type === 'ClassDeclaration'
 778:   ) {
 779:     // export function foo() {} / export class Foo {}
 780:     // export declarations must be named.
 781:     bindings[node.id.name] = BindingTypes.SETUP_CONST
 782:   }
 783: }
 784: 
 785: function walkObjectPattern(node, bindings, isConst, isDefineCall = false) {
 786:   for (const p of node.properties) {
 787:     if (p.type === 'ObjectProperty') {
 788:       if (p.key.type === 'Identifier' && p.key === p.value) {
 789:         // shorthand: const { x } = ...
 790:         const type = isDefineCall
 791:           ? BindingTypes.SETUP_CONST
 792:           : isConst
 793:           ? BindingTypes.SETUP_MAYBE_REF
 794:           : BindingTypes.SETUP_LET
 795:         registerBinding(bindings, p.key, type)
 796:       } else {
 797:         walkPattern(p.value, bindings, isConst, isDefineCall)
 798:       }
 799:     } else {
 800:       // ...rest
 801:       // argument can only be identifier when destructuring
 802:       const type = isConst ? BindingTypes.SETUP_CONST : BindingTypes.SETUP_LET
 803:       registerBinding(bindings, p.argument, type)
 804:     }
 805:   }
 806: }
 807: 
 808: 
 809: function walkArrayPattern(node, bindings, isConst, isDefineCall = false) {
 810:   for (const e of node.elements) {
 811:     e && walkPattern(e, bindings, isConst, isDefineCall)
 812:   }
 813: }
 814: function walkPattern(node, bindings, isConst, isDefineCall = false) {
 815:   if (node.type === 'Identifier') {
 816:     const type = isDefineCall
 817:       ? BindingTypes.SETUP_CONST
 818:       : isConst
 819:       ? BindingTypes.SETUP_MAYBE_REF
 820:       : BindingTypes.SETUP_LET
 821:     registerBinding(bindings, node, type)
 822:   } else if (node.type === 'RestElement') {
 823:     // argument can only be identifier when destructuring
 824:     const type = isConst ? BindingTypes.SETUP_CONST : BindingTypes.SETUP_LET
 825:     registerBinding(bindings, node.argument, type)
 826:   } else if (node.type === 'ObjectPattern') {
 827:     walkObjectPattern(node, bindings, isConst)
 828:   } else if (node.type === 'ArrayPattern') {
 829:     walkArrayPattern(node, bindings, isConst)
 830:   } else if (node.type === 'AssignmentPattern') {
 831:     if (node.left.type === 'Identifier') {
 832:       const type = isDefineCall
 833:         ? BindingTypes.SETUP_CONST
 834:         : isConst
 835:         ? BindingTypes.SETUP_MAYBE_REF
 836:         : BindingTypes.SETUP_LET
 837:       registerBinding(bindings, node.left, type)
 838:     } else {
 839:       walkPattern(node.left, bindings, isConst)
 840:     }
 841:   }
 842: }
 843: function recordType(node, declaredTypes) {
 844:   if (node.type === 'TSInterfaceDeclaration') {
 845:     declaredTypes[node.id.name] = [`Object`]
 846:   } else if (node.type === 'TSTypeAliasDeclaration') {
 847:     declaredTypes[node.id.name] = inferRuntimeType(
 848:       node.typeAnnotation,
 849:       declaredTypes
 850:     )
 851:   } else if (node.type === 'ExportNamedDeclaration' && node.declaration) {
 852:     recordType(node.declaration, declaredTypes)
 853:   }
 854: }
 855: function extractRuntimeProps(node, props, declaredTypes, isProd) {
 856:   const members = node.type === 'TSTypeLiteral' ? node.members : node.body
 857:   for (const m of members) {
 858:     if (
 859:       (m.type === 'TSPropertySignature' || m.type === 'TSMethodSignature') &&
 860:       m.key.type === 'Identifier'
 861:     ) {
 862:       let type
 863:       if (m.type === 'TSMethodSignature') {
 864:         type = ['Function']
 865:       } else if (m.typeAnnotation) {
 866:         type = inferRuntimeType(m.typeAnnotation.typeAnnotation, declaredTypes)
 867:       }
 868:       props[m.key.name] = {
 869:         key: m.key.name,
 870:         required: !m.optional,
 871:         type: type || [`null`]
 872:       }
 873:     }
 874:   }
 875: }
 876: 
 877: 
 878: function inferRuntimeType(node, declaredTypes) {
 879:   switch (node.type) {
 880:     case 'TSStringKeyword':
 881:       return ['String']
 882:     case 'TSNumberKeyword':
 883:       return ['Number']
 884:     case 'TSBooleanKeyword':
 885:       return ['Boolean']
 886:     case 'TSObjectKeyword':
 887:       return ['Object']
 888:     case 'TSTypeLiteral':
 889:       // TODO (nice to have) generate runtime property validation
 890:       return ['Object']
 891:     case 'TSFunctionType':
 892:       return ['Function']
 893:     case 'TSArrayType':
 894:     case 'TSTupleType':
 895:       // TODO (nice to have) generate runtime element type/length checks
 896:       return ['Array']
 897: 
 898:     case 'TSLiteralType':
 899:       switch (node.literal.type) {
 900:         case 'StringLiteral':
 901:           return ['String']
 902:         case 'BooleanLiteral':
 903:           return ['Boolean']
 904:         case 'NumericLiteral':
 905:         case 'BigIntLiteral':
 906:           return ['Number']
 907:         default:
 908:           return [`null`]
 909:       }
 910: 
 911:     case 'TSTypeReference':
 912:       if (node.typeName.type === 'Identifier') {
 913:         if (declaredTypes[node.typeName.name]) {
 914:           return declaredTypes[node.typeName.name]
 915:         }
 916:         switch (node.typeName.name) {
 917:           case 'Array':
 918:           case 'Function':
 919:           case 'Object':
 920:           case 'Set':
 921:           case 'Map':
 922:           case 'WeakSet':
 923:           case 'WeakMap':
 924:           case 'Date':
 925:             return [node.typeName.name]
 926:           case 'Record':
 927:           case 'Partial':
 928:           case 'Readonly':
 929:           case 'Pick':
 930:           case 'Omit':
 931:           case 'Exclude':
 932:           case 'Extract':
 933:           case 'Required':
 934:           case 'InstanceType':
 935:             return ['Object']
 936:         }
 937:       }
 938:       return [`null`]
 939: 
 940:     case 'TSParenthesizedType':
 941:       return inferRuntimeType(node.typeAnnotation, declaredTypes)
 942:     case 'TSUnionType':
 943:       return [
 944:         ...new Set(
 945:           [].concat(
 946:             ...(node.types.map(t => inferRuntimeType(t, declaredTypes)))
 947:           )
 948:         )
 949:       ]
 950:     case 'TSIntersectionType':
 951:       return ['Object']
 952: 
 953:     case 'TSSymbolKeyword':
 954:       return ['Symbol']
 955: 
 956:     default:
 957:       return [`null`] // no runtime check
 958:   }
 959: }
 960: function toRuntimeTypeString(types) {
 961:   return types.length > 1 ? `[${types.join(', ')}]` : types[0]
 962: }
 963: function extractRuntimeEmits(node, emits) {
 964:   if (node.type === 'TSTypeLiteral' || node.type === 'TSInterfaceBody') {
 965:     const members = node.type === 'TSTypeLiteral' ? node.members : node.body
 966:     for (let t of members) {
 967:       if (t.type === 'TSCallSignatureDeclaration') {
 968:         extractEventNames(t.parameters[0], emits)
 969:       }
 970:     }
 971:     return
 972:   } else {
 973:     extractEventNames(node.parameters[0], emits)
 974:   }
 975: }
 976: function extractEventNames(eventName, emits) {
 977:   if (
 978:     eventName.type === 'Identifier' &&
 979:     eventName.typeAnnotation &&
 980:     eventName.typeAnnotation.type === 'TSTypeAnnotation'
 981:   ) {
 982:     const typeNode = eventName.typeAnnotation.typeAnnotation
 983:     if (typeNode.type === 'TSLiteralType') {
 984:       if (typeNode.literal.type !== 'UnaryExpression') {
 985:         emits.add(String(typeNode.literal.value))
 986:       }
 987:     } else if (typeNode.type === 'TSUnionType') {
 988:       for (const t of typeNode.types) {
 989:         if (
 990:           t.type === 'TSLiteralType' &&
 991:           t.literal.type !== 'UnaryExpression'
 992:         ) {
 993:           emits.add(String(t.literal.value))
 994:         }
 995:       }
 996:     }
 997:   }
 998: }
 999: function genRuntimeEmits(emits) {
1000:   return emits.size
1001:     ? `\n  emits: [${Array.from(emits)
1002:         .map(p => JSON.stringify(p))
1003:         .join(', ')}],`
1004:     : ``
1005: }
1006: function isCallOf(node, test) {
1007:   return !!(
1008:     node &&
1009:     node.type === 'CallExpression' &&
1010:     node.callee.type === 'Identifier' &&
1011:     (typeof test === 'string'
1012:       ? node.callee.name === test
1013:       : test(node.callee.name))
1014:   )
1015: }
1016: function canNeverBeRef(node, userReactiveImport) {
1017:   if (isCallOf(node, userReactiveImport)) {
1018:     return true
1019:   }
1020:   switch (node.type) {
1021:     case 'UnaryExpression':
1022:     case 'BinaryExpression':
1023:     case 'ArrayExpression':
1024:     case 'ObjectExpression':
1025:     case 'FunctionExpression':
1026:     case 'ArrowFunctionExpression':
1027:     case 'UpdateExpression':
1028:     case 'ClassExpression':
1029:     case 'TaggedTemplateExpression':
1030:       return true
1031:     case 'SequenceExpression':
1032:       return canNeverBeRef(
1033:         node.expressions[node.expressions.length - 1],
1034:         userReactiveImport
1035:       )
1036:     default:
1037:       if (node.type.endsWith('Literal')) {
1038:         return true
1039:       }
1040:       return false
1041:   }
1042: }
1043: 
1044: 
1045: /**
1046:  * Analyze bindings in normal `<script>`
1047:  * Note that `compileScriptSetup` already analyzes bindings as part of its
1048:  * compilation process so this should only be used on single `<script>` SFCs.
1049:  */
1050: function analyzeScriptBindings(ast) {
1051:   for (const node of ast) {
1052:     if (
1053:       node.type === 'ExportDefaultDeclaration' &&
1054:       node.declaration.type === 'ObjectExpression'
1055:     ) {
1056:       return analyzeBindingsFromOptions(node.declaration)
1057:     }
1058:   }
1059:   return {}
1060: }
1061: function analyzeBindingsFromOptions(node) {
1062:   const bindings = {}
1063:   // #3270, #3275
1064:   // mark non-script-setup so we don't resolve components/directives from these
1065:   Object.defineProperty(bindings, '__isScriptSetup', {
1066:     enumerable: false,
1067:     value: false
1068:   })
1069:   for (const property of node.properties) {
1070:     if (
1071:       property.type === 'ObjectProperty' &&
1072:       !property.computed &&
1073:       property.key.type === 'Identifier'
1074:     ) {
1075:       // props
1076:       if (property.key.name === 'props') {
1077:         // props: ['foo']
1078:         // props: { foo: ... }
1079:         for (const key of getObjectOrArrayExpressionKeys(property.value)) {
1080:           bindings[key] = BindingTypes.PROPS
1081:         }
1082:       }
1083: 
1084:       // inject
1085:       else if (property.key.name === 'inject') {
1086:         // inject: ['foo']
1087:         // inject: { foo: {} }
1088:         for (const key of getObjectOrArrayExpressionKeys(property.value)) {
1089:           bindings[key] = BindingTypes.OPTIONS
1090:         }
1091:       }
1092: 
1093:       // computed & methods
1094:       else if (
1095:         property.value.type === 'ObjectExpression' &&
1096:         (property.key.name === 'computed' || property.key.name === 'methods')
1097:       ) {
1098:         // methods: { foo() {} }
1099:         // computed: { foo() {} }
1100:         for (const key of getObjectExpressionKeys(property.value)) {
1101:           bindings[key] = BindingTypes.OPTIONS
1102:         }
1103:       }
1104:     }
1105: 
1106:     // setup & data
1107:     else if (
1108:       property.type === 'ObjectMethod' &&
1109:       property.key.type === 'Identifier' &&
1110:       (property.key.name === 'setup' || property.key.name === 'data')
1111:     ) {
1112:       for (const bodyItem of property.body.body) {
1113:         // setup() {
1114:         //   return {
1115:         //     foo: null
1116:         //   }
1117:         // }
1118:         if (
1119:           bodyItem.type === 'ReturnStatement' &&
1120:           bodyItem.argument &&
1121:           bodyItem.argument.type === 'ObjectExpression'
1122:         ) {
1123:           for (const key of getObjectExpressionKeys(bodyItem.argument)) {
1124:             bindings[key] =
1125:               property.key.name === 'setup'
1126:                 ? BindingTypes.SETUP_MAYBE_REF
1127:                 : BindingTypes.DATA
1128:           }
1129:         }
1130:       }
1131:     }
1132:   }
1133: 
1134:   return bindings
1135: }
1136: function getObjectExpressionKeys(node) {
1137:   const keys = []
1138:   for (const prop of node.properties) {
1139:     if (
1140:       (prop.type === 'ObjectProperty' || prop.type === 'ObjectMethod') &&
1141:       !prop.computed
1142:     ) {
1143:       if (prop.key.type === 'Identifier') {
1144:         keys.push(prop.key.name)
1145:       } else if (prop.key.type === 'StringLiteral') {
1146:         keys.push(prop.key.value)
1147:       }
1148:     }
1149:   }
1150:   return keys
1151: }
1152: function getArrayExpressionKeys(node) {
1153:   const keys = []
1154:   for (const element of node.elements) {
1155:     if (element && element.type === 'StringLiteral') {
1156:       keys.push(element.value)
1157:     }
1158:   }
1159:   return keys
1160: }
1161: function getObjectOrArrayExpressionKeys(value) {
1162:   if (value.type === 'ArrayExpression') {
1163:     return getArrayExpressionKeys(value)
1164:   }
1165:   if (value.type === 'ObjectExpression') {
1166:     return getObjectExpressionKeys(value)
1167:   }
1168:   return []
1169: }
1170: function resolveTemplateUsageCheckString(sfc) {
1171:   const { content, ast } = sfc.template
1172:   const cached = templateUsageCheckCache.get(content)
1173:   if (cached) {
1174:     return cached
1175:   }
1176: 
1177:   let code = ''
1178:   transform(createRoot([ast]), {
1179:     nodeTransforms: [
1180:       node => {
1181:         if (node.type === NodeTypes.ELEMENT) {
1182:           if (
1183:             !parserOptions.isNativeTag(node.tag) &&
1184:             !parserOptions.isBuiltInComponent(node.tag)
1185:           ) {
1186:             code += `,${camelize(node.tag)},${capitalize(camelize(node.tag))}`
1187:           }
1188:           for (let i = 0; i < node.props.length; i++) {
1189:             const prop = node.props[i]
1190:             if (prop.type === NodeTypes.DIRECTIVE) {
1191:               if (!isBuiltInDir(prop.name)) {
1192:                 code += `,v${capitalize(camelize(prop.name))}`
1193:               }
1194:               if (prop.exp) {
1195:                 code += `,${stripStrings(prop.exp.content)}`
1196:               }
1197:             }
1198:           }
1199:         } else if (node.type === NodeTypes.INTERPOLATION) {
1200:           code += `,${stripStrings(node.content.content)}`
1201:         }
1202:       }
1203:     ]
1204:   })
1205: 
1206:   code += ';'
1207:   templateUsageCheckCache.set(content, code)
1208:   return code
1209: }
1210: function stripStrings(exp) {
1211:   return exp
1212:     .replace(/'[^']*'|"[^"]*"/g, '')
1213:     .replace(/`[^`]+`/g, stripTemplateString)
1214: }
1215: function isImportUsed(local, sfc) {
1216:   return new RegExp(
1217:     // #4274 escape $ since it's a special char in regex
1218:     // (and is the only regex special char that is valid in identifiers)
1219:     `[^\\w$_]${local.replace(/\$/g, '\\$')}[^\\w$_]`
1220:   ).test(resolveTemplateUsageCheckString(sfc))
1221: }
1222: /**
1223:  * Note: this comparison assumes the prev/next script are already identical,
1224:  * and only checks the special case where <script setup lang="ts"> unused import
1225:  * pruning result changes due to template changes.
1226:  */
1227: function hmrShouldReload(prevImports, next) {
1228:   if (
1229:     !next.scriptSetup ||
1230:     (next.scriptSetup.lang !== 'ts' && next.scriptSetup.lang !== 'tsx')
1231:   ) {
1232:     return false
1233:   }
1234: 
1235:   // for each previous import, check if its used status remain the same based on
1236:   // the next descriptor's template
1237:   for (const key in prevImports) {
1238:     // if an import was previous unused, but now is used, we need to force
1239:     // reload so that the script now includes that import.
1240:     if (!prevImports[key].isUsedInTemplate && isImportUsed(key, next)) {
1241:       return true
1242:     }
1243:   }
1244: 
1245:   return false
1246: }
1247: function compileTemplate(options) {
1248:   // ... compile
1249: 
1250:   return doCompileTemplate(options)
1251: }
1252: 
1253: function doCompileTemplate({
1254:   filename,
1255:   id,
1256:   scoped,
1257:   slotted,
1258:   inMap,
1259:   source,
1260:   ssr = false,
1261:   ssrCssVars,
1262:   isProd = false,
1263:   compiler,
1264:   compilerOptions = {},
1265:   transformAssetUrls
1266: }) {
1267:   const errors = []
1268:   const warnings = []
1269: 
1270:   let nodeTransforms = []
1271:   if (isObject(transformAssetUrls)) {
1272:     const assetOptions = normalizeOptions(transformAssetUrls)
1273:     nodeTransforms = [
1274:       createAssetUrlTransformWithOptions(assetOptions),
1275:       createSrcsetTransformWithOptions(assetOptions)
1276:     ]
1277:   } else if (transformAssetUrls !== false) {
1278:     nodeTransforms = [transformAssetUrl, transformSrcset]
1279:   }
1280: 
1281:   if (!id) {
1282:     id = ''
1283:   }
1284: 
1285:   const shortId = id.replace(/^data-v-/, '')
1286:   const longId = `data-v-${shortId}`
1287: 
1288:   let { code, ast, preamble, map } = baseCompile(source, {
1289:     mode: 'module',
1290:     prefixIdentifiers: true,
1291:     hoistStatic: true,
1292:     cacheHandlers: true,
1293:     ssrCssVars:
1294:       ssr && ssrCssVars && ssrCssVars.length
1295:         ? genCssVarsFromList(ssrCssVars, shortId, isProd)
1296:         : '',
1297:     scopeId: scoped ? longId : undefined,
1298:     slotted,
1299:     sourceMap: true,
1300:     ...compilerOptions,
1301:     nodeTransforms: nodeTransforms.concat(compilerOptions.nodeTransforms || []),
1302:     filename,
1303:     onError: e => errors.push(e),
1304:     onWarn: w => warnings.push(w)
1305:   })
1306: 
1307:   return { code, ast, preamble, source, errors, tips, map }
1308: }
1309: const hash = require(process.env.NODE_LIB + '/hash-sum')
1310: const CSS_VARS_HELPER = `useCssVars`
1311: // match v-bind() with max 2-levels of nested parens.
1312: const cssVarRE = /v-bind\s*\(((?:[^)(]+|\((?:[^)(]+|\([^)(]*\))*\))*)\)/g
1313: 
1314: function genCssVarsFromList(
1315:   vars,
1316:   id,
1317:   isProd
1318: ) {
1319:   return `{\n  ${vars
1320:     .map(key => `"${genVarName(id, key, isProd)}": (${key})`)
1321:     .join(',\n  ')}\n}`
1322: }
1323: 
1324: function genVarName(id, raw, isProd) {
1325:   if (isProd) {
1326:     return hash(id + raw)
1327:   } else {
1328:     return `${id}-${raw.replace(/([^\w-])/g, '_')}`
1329:   }
1330: }
1331: 
1332: function noramlizeExpression(exp) {
1333:   exp = exp.trim()
1334:   if (
1335:     (exp[0] === `'` && exp[exp.length - 1] === `'`) ||
1336:     (exp[0] === `"` && exp[exp.length - 1] === `"`)
1337:   ) {
1338:     return exp.slice(1, -1)
1339:   }
1340:   return exp
1341: }
1342: 
1343: function parseCssVars(sfc) {
1344:   const vars = []
1345:   sfc.styles.forEach(style => {
1346:     let match
1347:     // ignore v-bind() in comments /* ... */
1348:     const content = style.content.replace(/\/\*([\s\S]*?)\*\//g, '')
1349:     while ((match = cssVarRE.exec(content))) {
1350:       const variable = noramlizeExpression(match[1])
1351:       if (!vars.includes(variable)) {
1352:         vars.push(variable)
1353:       }
1354:     }
1355:   })
1356:   return vars
1357: }
1358: 
1359: // for compileStyle
1360: 
1361: const cssVarsPlugin = opts => {
1362:   const { id, isProd } = opts
1363:   return {
1364:     postcssPlugin: 'vue-sfc-vars',
1365:     Declaration(decl) {
1366:       // rewrite CSS variables
1367:       if (cssVarRE.test(decl.value)) {
1368:         decl.value = decl.value.replace(cssVarRE, (_, $1) => {
1369:           return `var(--${genVarName(id, noramlizeExpression($1), isProd)})`
1370:         })
1371:       }
1372:     }
1373:   }
1374: }
1375: cssVarsPlugin.postcss = true
1376: 
1377: function genCssVarsCode(
1378:   vars,
1379:   bindings,
1380:   id,
1381:   isProd
1382: ) {
1383:   const varsExp = genCssVarsFromList(vars, id, isProd)
1384:   const exp = createSimpleExpression(varsExp, false)
1385:   const context = createTransformContext(createRoot([]), {
1386:     prefixIdentifiers: true,
1387:     inline: true,
1388:     bindingMetadata: bindings.__isScriptSetup === false ? undefined : bindings
1389:   })
1390:   const transformed = processExpression(exp, context)
1391:   const transformedString =
1392:     transformed.type === NodeTypes.SIMPLE_EXPRESSION
1393:       ? transformed.content
1394:       : transformed.children
1395:           .map(c => {
1396:             return typeof c === 'string'
1397:               ? c
1398:               : c.content
1399:           })
1400:           .join('')
1401: 
1402:   return `_${CSS_VARS_HELPER}(_ctx => (${transformedString}))`
1403: }
1404: 
1405: // <script setup> already gets the calls injected as part of the transform
1406: // this is only for single normal <script>
1407: function genNormalScriptCssVarsCode(
1408:   cssVars,
1409:   bindings,
1410:   id,
1411:   isProd
1412: ) {
1413:   return (
1414:     `\nimport { ${CSS_VARS_HELPER} as _${CSS_VARS_HELPER} } from 'vue'\n` +
1415:     `const __injectCSSVars__ = () => {\n${genCssVarsCode(
1416:       cssVars,
1417:       bindings,
1418:       id,
1419:       isProd
1420:     )}}\n` +
1421:     `const __setup__ = __default__.setup\n` +
1422:     `__default__.setup = __setup__\n` +
1423:     `  ? (props, ctx) => { __injectCSSVars__();return __setup__(props, ctx) }\n` +
1424:     `  : __injectCSSVars__\n`
1425:   )
1426: }
1427: 
1428: 
1429: // Special compiler macros
1430: const DEFINE_PROPS = 'defineProps'
1431: const DEFINE_EMITS = 'defineEmits'
1432: const DEFINE_EXPOSE = 'defineExpose'
1433: const WITH_DEFAULTS = 'withDefaults'
1434: const templateUsageCheckCache = createCache()
1435: 
1436: // constants
1437: const DEFAULT_VAR = `__default__`
1438: 
1439: const isBuiltInDir = makeMap(
1440:   `once,memo,if,else,else-if,slot,text,html,on,bind,model,show,cloak,is`
1441: )
1442: 
1443: function compileScript(sfc, options) {
1444:   let { script, scriptSetup, source, filename } = sfc
1445:   // feature flags
1446:   // TODO remove support for deprecated options when out of experimental
1447:   const enableReactivityTransform =
1448:     !!options.reactivityTransform ||
1449:     !!options.refSugar ||
1450:     !!options.refTransform
1451:   const enablePropsTransform =
1452:     !!options.reactivityTransform || !!options.propsDestructureTransform
1453:   const isProd = !!options.isProd
1454:   const genSourceMap = options.sourceMap !== false
1455:   // ref 
1456:   let refBindings
1457: 
1458:   const scopeId = options.id ? options.id.replace(/^data-v-/, '') : ''
1459:   const cssVars = sfc.cssVars
1460:   const scriptLang = script && script.lang
1461:   const scriptSetupLang = scriptSetup && scriptSetup.lang
1462:   const isTS =
1463:     scriptLang === 'ts' ||
1464:     scriptLang === 'tsx' ||
1465:     scriptSetupLang === 'ts' ||
1466:     scriptSetupLang === 'tsx'
1467: 
1468:   // resolve parser plugins
1469:   const plugins = []
1470:   if (!isTS || scriptLang === 'tsx' || scriptSetupLang === 'tsx') {
1471:     plugins.push('jsx')
1472:   }
1473:   if (options.babelParserPlugins) plugins.push(...options.babelParserPlugins)
1474:   if (isTS) plugins.push('typescript', 'decorators-legacy')
1475: 
1476:   if (!scriptSetup) {
1477:     if (!script) {
1478:       throw new Error(`[@vue/compiler-sfc] SFC contains no <script> tags.`)
1479:     }
1480:     if (scriptLang && !isTS && scriptLang !== 'jsx') {
1481:       // do not process non js/ts script blocks
1482:       return script
1483:     }
1484:     try {
1485:       let content = script.content
1486:       let map = script.map
1487:       const scriptAst = babelParser.parse(content, {
1488:         plugins,
1489:         sourceType: 'module'
1490:       }).program
1491:       const bindings = analyzeScriptBindings(scriptAst.body)
1492:       if (enableReactivityTransform && RT.shouldTransform(content)) {
1493:         const s = new MagicString(source)
1494:         const startOffset = script.loc.start.offset
1495:         const endOffset = script.loc.end.offset
1496:         const { importedHelpers } = RT.transformAST(scriptAst, s, startOffset)
1497:         if (importedHelpers.length) {
1498:           s.prepend(
1499:             `import { ${importedHelpers
1500:               .map(h => `${h} as _${h}`)
1501:               .join(', ')} } from 'vue'\n`
1502:           )
1503:         }
1504:         s.remove(0, startOffset)
1505:         s.remove(endOffset, source.length)
1506:         content = s.toString()
1507:         if (genSourceMap) {
1508:           map = s.generateMap({
1509:             source: filename,
1510:             hires: true,
1511:             includeContent: true
1512:           })
1513:         }
1514:       }
1515:       if (cssVars.length) {
1516:         content = rewriteDefault(content, DEFAULT_VAR, plugins)
1517:         content += genNormalScriptCssVarsCode(
1518:           cssVars,
1519:           bindings,
1520:           scopeId,
1521:           isProd
1522:         )
1523:         content += `\nexport default ${DEFAULT_VAR}`
1524:       }
1525:       return {
1526:         ...script,
1527:         content,
1528:         map,
1529:         bindings,
1530:         scriptAst: scriptAst.body
1531:       }
1532:     } catch (e) {
1533:       // silently fallback if parse fails since user may be using custom
1534:       // babel syntax
1535:       return script
1536:     }
1537:   }
1538: 
1539:   // script  script setup 
1540:   if (script && scriptLang !== scriptSetupLang) {
1541:     throw new Error(
1542:       `[@vue/compiler-sfc] <script> and <script setup> must have the same ` +
1543:         `language type.`
1544:     )
1545:   }
1546: 
1547:   //  js/ts script
1548:   if (scriptSetupLang && !isTS && scriptSetupLang !== 'jsx') {
1549:     return scriptSetup
1550:   }
1551: 
1552:   // imports 
1553:   const bindingMetadata = {}
1554:   const helperImports = new Set()
1555:   const userImports = Object.create(null)
1556:   const userImportAlias = Object.create(null)
1557:   const scriptBindings = Object.create(null)
1558:   const setupBindings = Object.create(null)
1559: 
1560:   let defaultExport // export default
1561:   let hasDefinePropsCall = false // defineProps()
1562:   let hasDefineEmitCall = false // defineEmits()
1563:   let hasDefineExposeCall = false // defineExpose()
1564:   let propsRuntimeDecl // 
1565:   let propsRuntimeDefaults // 
1566:   let propsDestructureDecl // 
1567:   let propsDestructureRestId //  ... 
1568:   let propsTypeDecl // 
1569:   let propsTypeDeclRaw
1570:   let propsIdentifier
1571:   let emitsRuntimeDecl
1572:   let emitsTypeDecl
1573:   let emitsTypeDeclRaw
1574:   let emitIdentifier
1575:   let hasAwait = false //  await  async setup
1576:   let hasInlinedSsrRenderFn = false
1577:   // props/emits declared via types
1578:   const typeDeclaredProps = {}
1579:   const typeDeclaredEmits = new Set()
1580:   // record declared types for runtime props type generation
1581:   const declaredTypes = {}
1582:   // props destructure data
1583:   const propsDestructuredBindings = Object.create(null)
1584: 
1585:   // magic-string state
1586:   const s = new MagicString(source)
1587:   const startOffset = scriptSetup.loc.start.offset
1588:   const endOffset = scriptSetup.loc.end.offset
1589:   const scriptStartOffset = script && script.loc.start.offset
1590:   const scriptEndOffset = script && script.loc.end.offset
1591: 
1592:   function helper(key) {
1593:     helperImports.add(key)
1594:     return `_${key}`
1595:   }
1596:     function parse(input, options, offset) {
1597:       try {
1598:         return babelParser.parse(input, options).program
1599:       } catch (e) {
1600:         e.message = `[@vue/compiler-sfc] ${e.message}\n\n${
1601:           sfc.filename
1602:         }\n${generateCodeFrame(source, e.pos + offset, e.pos + offset + 1)}`
1603:         throw e
1604:       }
1605:     }
1606:   
1607:   
1608:   function error(msg, node, end = node.end + startOffset) {
1609:     throw new Error(
1610:       `[@vue/compiler-sfc] ${msg}\n\n${sfc.filename}\n${generateCodeFrame(
1611:       source,
1612:       node.start + startOffset,
1613:       end
1614:       )}`
1615:     )
1616:   }
1617:     function registerUserImport(source, local, imported, isType, isFromSetup) {
1618:       if (source === 'vue' && imported) {
1619:         userImportAlias[imported] = local
1620:       }
1621:   
1622:       let isUsedInTemplate = true
1623:       if (isTS && sfc.template && !sfc.template.src && !sfc.template.lang) {
1624:         isUsedInTemplate = isImportUsed(local, sfc)
1625:       }
1626:   
1627:       userImports[local] = {
1628:         isType,
1629:         imported: imported || 'default',
1630:         source,
1631:         isFromSetup,
1632:         isUsedInTemplate
1633:       }
1634:     }
1635:   
1636:     function processDefineProps(node, declId) {
1637:       if (!isCallOf(node, DEFINE_PROPS)) {
1638:         return false
1639:       }
1640:   
1641:       if (hasDefinePropsCall) {
1642:         error(`duplicate ${DEFINE_PROPS}() call`, node)
1643:       }
1644:       hasDefinePropsCall = true
1645:   
1646:       propsRuntimeDecl = node.arguments[0]
1647:   
1648:       // call has type parameters - infer runtime types from it
1649:       if (node.typeParameters) {
1650:         if (propsRuntimeDecl) {
1651:           error(
1652:             `${DEFINE_PROPS}() cannot accept both type and non-type arguments ` +
1653:               `at the same time. Use one or the other.`,
1654:             node
1655:           )
1656:         }
1657:   
1658:         propsTypeDeclRaw = node.typeParameters.params[0]
1659:         propsTypeDecl = resolveQualifiedType(
1660:           propsTypeDeclRaw,
1661:           node => node.type === 'TSTypeLiteral'
1662:         )
1663:   
1664:         if (!propsTypeDecl) {
1665:           error(
1666:             `type argument passed to ${DEFINE_PROPS}() must be a literal type, ` +
1667:               `or a reference to an interface or literal type.`,
1668:             propsTypeDeclRaw
1669:           )
1670:         }
1671:       }
1672:   
1673:       if (declId) {
1674:         if (enablePropsTransform && declId.type === 'ObjectPattern') {
1675:           propsDestructureDecl = declId
1676:           // props destructure - handle compilation sugar
1677:           for (const prop of declId.properties) {
1678:             if (prop.type === 'ObjectProperty') {
1679:               if (prop.computed) {
1680:                 error(
1681:                   `${DEFINE_PROPS}() destructure cannot use computed key.`,
1682:                   prop.key
1683:                 )
1684:               }
1685:               const propKey = prop.key.name
1686:               if (prop.value.type === 'AssignmentPattern') {
1687:                 // default value { foo = 123 }
1688:                 const { left, right } = prop.value
1689:                 if (left.type !== 'Identifier') {
1690:                   error(
1691:                     `${DEFINE_PROPS}() destructure does not support nested patterns.`,
1692:                     left
1693:                   )
1694:                 }
1695:                 // store default value
1696:                 propsDestructuredBindings[propKey] = {
1697:                   local: left.name,
1698:                   default: right
1699:                 }
1700:               } else if (prop.value.type === 'Identifier') {
1701:                 // simple destructure
1702:                 propsDestructuredBindings[propKey] = {
1703:                   local: prop.value.name
1704:                 }
1705:               } else {
1706:                 error(
1707:                   `${DEFINE_PROPS}() destructure does not support nested patterns.`,
1708:                   prop.value
1709:                 )
1710:               }
1711:             } else {
1712:               // rest spread
1713:               propsDestructureRestId = prop.argument.name
1714:             }
1715:           }
1716:         } else {
1717:           propsIdentifier = scriptSetup.content.slice(declId.start, declId.end)
1718:         }
1719:       }
1720:   
1721:       return true
1722:     }
1723:   
1724:   
1725:     function processWithDefaults(node, declId) {
1726:       if (!isCallOf(node, WITH_DEFAULTS)) {
1727:         return false
1728:       }
1729:       if (processDefineProps(node.arguments[0], declId)) {
1730:         if (propsRuntimeDecl) {
1731:           error(
1732:             `${WITH_DEFAULTS} can only be used with type-based ` +
1733:               `${DEFINE_PROPS} declaration.`,
1734:             node
1735:           )
1736:         }
1737:         if (propsDestructureDecl) {
1738:           error(
1739:             `${WITH_DEFAULTS}() is unnecessary when using destructure with ${DEFINE_PROPS}().\n` +
1740:               `Prefer using destructure default values, e.g. const { foo = 1 } = defineProps(...).`,
1741:             node.callee
1742:           )
1743:         }
1744:         propsRuntimeDefaults = node.arguments[1]
1745:         if (
1746:           !propsRuntimeDefaults ||
1747:           propsRuntimeDefaults.type !== 'ObjectExpression'
1748:         ) {
1749:           error(
1750:             `The 2nd argument of ${WITH_DEFAULTS} must be an object literal.`,
1751:             propsRuntimeDefaults || node
1752:           )
1753:         }
1754:       } else {
1755:         error(
1756:           `${WITH_DEFAULTS}' first argument must be a ${DEFINE_PROPS} call.`,
1757:           node.arguments[0] || node
1758:         )
1759:       }
1760:       return true
1761:     }
1762:   
1763:   
1764:   
1765:     function processDefineEmits(node, declId) {
1766:       if (!isCallOf(node, DEFINE_EMITS)) {
1767:         return false
1768:       }
1769:       if (hasDefineEmitCall) {
1770:         error(`duplicate ${DEFINE_EMITS}() call`, node)
1771:       }
1772:       hasDefineEmitCall = true
1773:       emitsRuntimeDecl = node.arguments[0]
1774:       if (node.typeParameters) {
1775:         if (emitsRuntimeDecl) {
1776:           error(
1777:             `${DEFINE_EMITS}() cannot accept both type and non-type arguments ` +
1778:               `at the same time. Use one or the other.`,
1779:             node
1780:           )
1781:         }
1782:   
1783:         emitsTypeDeclRaw = node.typeParameters.params[0]
1784:         emitsTypeDecl = resolveQualifiedType(
1785:           emitsTypeDeclRaw,
1786:           node => node.type === 'TSFunctionType' || node.type === 'TSTypeLiteral'
1787:         )
1788:   
1789:         if (!emitsTypeDecl) {
1790:           error(
1791:             `type argument passed to ${DEFINE_EMITS}() must be a function type, ` +
1792:               `a literal type with call signatures, or a reference to the above types.`,
1793:             emitsTypeDeclRaw
1794:           )
1795:         }
1796:       }
1797:   
1798:       if (declId) {
1799:         emitIdentifier = scriptSetup.content.slice(declId.start, declId.end)
1800:       }
1801:   
1802:       return true
1803:     }
1804:   
1805:   
1806:   
1807:     function resolveQualifiedType(node, qualifier) {
1808:       if (qualifier(node)) {
1809:         return node
1810:       }
1811:       if (
1812:         node.type === 'TSTypeReference' &&
1813:         node.typeName.type === 'Identifier'
1814:       ) {
1815:         const refName = node.typeName.name
1816:         const isQualifiedType = (node) => {
1817:           if (
1818:             node.type === 'TSInterfaceDeclaration' &&
1819:             node.id.name === refName
1820:           ) {
1821:             return node.body
1822:           } else if (
1823:             node.type === 'TSTypeAliasDeclaration' &&
1824:             node.id.name === refName &&
1825:             qualifier(node.typeAnnotation)
1826:           ) {
1827:             return node.typeAnnotation
1828:           } else if (node.type === 'ExportNamedDeclaration' && node.declaration) {
1829:             return isQualifiedType(node.declaration)
1830:           }
1831:         }
1832:         const body = scriptAst
1833:           ? [...scriptSetupAst.body, ...scriptAst.body]
1834:           : scriptSetupAst.body
1835:         for (const node of body) {
1836:           const qualified = isQualifiedType(node)
1837:           if (qualified) {
1838:             return qualified
1839:           }
1840:         }
1841:       }
1842:     }
1843:   
1844:   
1845:   function processDefineExpose(node) {
1846:       if (isCallOf(node, DEFINE_EXPOSE)) {
1847:         if (hasDefineExposeCall) {
1848:           error(`duplicate ${DEFINE_EXPOSE}() call`, node)
1849:         }
1850:         hasDefineExposeCall = true
1851:         return true
1852:       }
1853:       return false
1854:     }
1855:   
1856:   /**
1857:      * await foo()
1858:      * -->
1859:      * ;(
1860:      *   ([__temp,__restore] = withAsyncContext(() => foo())),
1861:      *   await __temp,
1862:      *   __restore()
1863:      * )
1864:      *
1865:      * const a = await foo()
1866:      * -->
1867:      * const a = (
1868:      *   ([__temp, __restore] = withAsyncContext(() => foo())),
1869:      *   __temp = await __temp,
1870:      *   __restore(),
1871:      *   __temp
1872:      * )
1873:      */
1874:     function processAwait(node, needSemi, isStatement) {
1875:       const argumentStart =
1876:         node.argument.extra && node.argument.extra.parenthesized
1877:           ? node.argument.extra.parenStart
1878:           : node.argument.start
1879:   
1880:       const argumentStr = source.slice(
1881:         argumentStart + startOffset,
1882:         node.argument.end + startOffset
1883:       )
1884:   
1885:       const containsNestedAwait = /\bawait\b/.test(argumentStr)
1886:   
1887:       s.overwrite(
1888:         node.start + startOffset,
1889:         argumentStart + startOffset,
1890:         `${needSemi ? `;` : ``}(\n  ([__temp,__restore] = ${helper(
1891:           `withAsyncContext`
1892:         )}(${containsNestedAwait ? `async ` : ``}() => `
1893:       )
1894:       s.appendLeft(
1895:         node.end + startOffset,
1896:         `)),\n  ${isStatement ? `` : `__temp = `}await __temp,\n  __restore()${
1897:           isStatement ? `` : `,\n  __temp`
1898:         }\n)`
1899:       )
1900:     }
1901:   
1902:   
1903:   /**
1904:      * check defaults. If the default object is an object literal with only
1905:      * static properties, we can directly generate more optimized default
1906:      * declarations. Otherwise we will have to fallback to runtime merging.
1907:      */
1908:     function hasStaticWithDefaults() {
1909:       return (
1910:         propsRuntimeDefaults &&
1911:         propsRuntimeDefaults.type === 'ObjectExpression' &&
1912:         propsRuntimeDefaults.properties.every(
1913:           node =>
1914:             (node.type === 'ObjectProperty' && !node.computed) ||
1915:             node.type === 'ObjectMethod'
1916:         )
1917:       )
1918:     }
1919:   function genRuntimeProps(props) {
1920:       const keys = Object.keys(props)
1921:       if (!keys.length) {
1922:         return ``
1923:       }
1924:       const hasStaticDefaults = hasStaticWithDefaults()
1925:       const scriptSetupSource = scriptSetup.content
1926:       let propsDecls = `{
1927:       ${keys
1928:         .map(key => {
1929:           let defaultString
1930:           const destructured = genDestructuredDefaultValue(key)
1931:           if (destructured) {
1932:             defaultString = `default: ${destructured}`
1933:           } else if (hasStaticDefaults) {
1934:             const prop = propsRuntimeDefaults.properties.find(
1935:               (node) => node.key.name === key
1936:             )
1937:             if (prop) {
1938:               if (prop.type === 'ObjectProperty') {
1939:                 // prop has corresponding static default value
1940:                 defaultString = `default: ${scriptSetupSource.slice(
1941:                   prop.value.start,
1942:                   prop.value.end
1943:                 )}`
1944:               } else {
1945:                 defaultString = `default() ${scriptSetupSource.slice(
1946:                   prop.body.start,
1947:                   prop.body.end
1948:                 )}`
1949:               }
1950:             }
1951:           }
1952:   
1953:           const { type, required } = props[key]
1954:           if (!isProd) {
1955:             return `${key}: { type: ${toRuntimeTypeString(
1956:               type
1957:             )}, required: ${required}${
1958:               defaultString ? `, ${defaultString}` : ``
1959:             } }`
1960:           } else if (
1961:             type.some(
1962:               el => el === 'Boolean' || (defaultString && el === 'Function')
1963:             )
1964:           ) {
1965:             // #4783 production: if boolean or defaultString and function exists, should keep the type.
1966:             return `${key}: { type: ${toRuntimeTypeString(type)}${
1967:               defaultString ? `, ${defaultString}` : ``
1968:             } }`
1969:           } else {
1970:             // production: checks are useless
1971:             return `${key}: ${defaultString ? `{ ${defaultString} }` : 'null'}`
1972:           }
1973:         })
1974:         .join(',\n    ')}\n  }`
1975:   
1976:       if (propsRuntimeDefaults && !hasStaticDefaults) {
1977:         propsDecls = `${helper('mergeDefaults')}(${propsDecls}, ${source.slice(
1978:           propsRuntimeDefaults.start + startOffset,
1979:           propsRuntimeDefaults.end + startOffset
1980:         )})`
1981:       }
1982:   
1983:       return `\n  props: ${propsDecls},`
1984:     }
1985:   
1986:   
1987:   function genDestructuredDefaultValue(key) {
1988:       const destructured = propsDestructuredBindings[key]
1989:       if (destructured && destructured.default) {
1990:         const value = scriptSetup.content.slice(
1991:           destructured.default.start,
1992:           destructured.default.end
1993:         )
1994:         const isLiteral = destructured.default.type.endsWith('Literal')
1995:         return isLiteral ? value : `() => ${value}`
1996:       }
1997:     }
1998:   
1999:     function genSetupPropsType(node) {
2000:       const scriptSetupSource = scriptSetup.content
2001:       if (hasStaticWithDefaults()) {
2002:         // if withDefaults() is used, we need to remove the optional flags
2003:         // on props that have default values
2004:         let res = `{ `
2005:         const members = node.type === 'TSTypeLiteral' ? node.members : node.body
2006:         for (const m of members) {
2007:           if (
2008:             (m.type === 'TSPropertySignature' ||
2009:               m.type === 'TSMethodSignature') &&
2010:             m.typeAnnotation &&
2011:             m.key.type === 'Identifier'
2012:           ) {
2013:             if (
2014:               propsRuntimeDefaults.properties.some(
2015:                 (p) => p.key.name === m.key.name
2016:               )
2017:             ) {
2018:               res +=
2019:                 m.key.name +
2020:                 (m.type === 'TSMethodSignature' ? '()' : '') +
2021:                 scriptSetupSource.slice(
2022:                   m.typeAnnotation.start,
2023:                   m.typeAnnotation.end
2024:                 ) +
2025:                 ', '
2026:             } else {
2027:               res +=
2028:                 scriptSetupSource.slice(m.start, m.typeAnnotation.end) + `, `
2029:             }
2030:           }
2031:         }
2032:         return (res.length ? res.slice(0, -2) : res) + ` }`
2033:       } else {
2034:         return scriptSetupSource.slice(node.start, node.end)
2035:       }
2036:     }
2037:   function processNormalScript() {
2038:     let scriptAst
2039:     if (script) {
2040:       scriptAst = parse(
2041:         script.content,
2042:         {
2043:           plugins,
2044:           sourceType: 'module'
2045:         },
2046:         scriptStartOffset
2047:       )
2048:   
2049:       for (const node of scriptAst.body) {
2050:         if (node.type === 'ImportDeclaration') {
2051:           // record imports for dedupe
2052:           for (const specifier of node.specifiers) {
2053:             const imported =
2054:               specifier.type === 'ImportSpecifier' &&
2055:               specifier.imported.type === 'Identifier' &&
2056:               specifier.imported.name
2057:             registerUserImport(
2058:               node.source.value,
2059:               specifier.local.name,
2060:               imported,
2061:               node.importKind === 'type' ||
2062:                 (specifier.type === 'ImportSpecifier' &&
2063:                   specifier.importKind === 'type'),
2064:               false
2065:             )
2066:           }
2067:         } else if (node.type === 'ExportDefaultDeclaration') {
2068:           // export default
2069:           defaultExport = node
2070:           // export default { ... } --> const __default__ = { ... }
2071:           const start = node.start + scriptStartOffset
2072:           const end = node.declaration.start + scriptStartOffset
2073:           s.overwrite(start, end, `const ${DEFAULT_VAR} = `)
2074:         } else if (node.type === 'ExportNamedDeclaration') {
2075:           const defaultSpecifier = node.specifiers.find(
2076:             s => s.exported.type === 'Identifier' && s.exported.name === 'default'
2077:           )
2078:           if (defaultSpecifier) {
2079:             defaultExport = node
2080:             // 1. remove specifier
2081:             if (node.specifiers.length > 1) {
2082:               s.remove(
2083:                 defaultSpecifier.start + scriptStartOffset,
2084:                 defaultSpecifier.end + scriptStartOffset
2085:               )
2086:             } else {
2087:               s.remove(
2088:                 node.start + scriptStartOffset,
2089:                 node.end + scriptStartOffset
2090:               )
2091:             }
2092:             if (node.source) {
2093:               // export { x as default } from './x'
2094:               // rewrite to `import { x as __default__ } from './x'` and
2095:               // add to top
2096:               s.prepend(
2097:                 `import { ${defaultSpecifier.local.name} as ${DEFAULT_VAR} } from '${node.source.value}'\n`
2098:               )
2099:             } else {
2100:               // export { x as default }
2101:               // rewrite to `const __default__ = x` and move to end
2102:               s.appendLeft(
2103:                 scriptEndOffset,
2104:                 `\nconst ${DEFAULT_VAR} = ${defaultSpecifier.local.name}\n`
2105:               )
2106:             }
2107:           }
2108:           if (node.declaration) {
2109:             walkDeclaration(node.declaration, scriptBindings, userImportAlias)
2110:           }
2111:         } else if (
2112:           (node.type === 'VariableDeclaration' ||
2113:             node.type === 'FunctionDeclaration' ||
2114:             node.type === 'ClassDeclaration' ||
2115:             node.type === 'TSEnumDeclaration') &&
2116:           !node.declare
2117:         ) {
2118:           walkDeclaration(node, scriptBindings, userImportAlias)
2119:         }
2120:       }
2121:   
2122:       // apply reactivity transform
2123:       if (enableReactivityTransform && RT.shouldTransform(script.content)) {
2124:         const { rootRefs, importedHelpers } = transformAST(
2125:           scriptAst,
2126:           s,
2127:           scriptStartOffset
2128:         )
2129:         refBindings = rootRefs
2130:         for (const h of importedHelpers) {
2131:           helperImports.add(h)
2132:         }
2133:       }
2134:   
2135:       // <script> after <script setup>
2136:       // we need to move the block up so that `const __default__` is
2137:       // declared before being used in the actual component definition
2138:       if (scriptStartOffset > startOffset) {
2139:         s.move(scriptStartOffset, scriptEndOffset, 0)
2140:       }
2141:     }
2142:   
2143:     return scriptAst
2144:   }
2145:   function processSetupScript() {
2146:     const scriptSetupAst = babelParser.parse(
2147:       scriptSetup.content,
2148:       {
2149:         plugins: [
2150:           ...plugins,
2151:           // allow top level await but only inside <script setup>
2152:           'topLevelAwait'
2153:         ],
2154:         sourceType: 'module'
2155:       },
2156:       startOffset
2157:     )
2158:   
2159:     for (const node of scriptSetupAst.body) {
2160:       const start = node.start + startOffset
2161:       let end = node.end + startOffset
2162:       // locate comment
2163:       if (node.trailingComments && node.trailingComments.length > 0) {
2164:         const lastCommentNode =
2165:           node.trailingComments[node.trailingComments.length - 1]
2166:         end = lastCommentNode.end + startOffset
2167:       }
2168:       // locate the end of whitespace between this statement and the next
2169:       while (end <= source.length) {
2170:         if (!/\s/.test(source.charAt(end))) {
2171:           break
2172:         }
2173:         end++
2174:       }
2175:   
2176:       // (Dropped) `ref: x` bindings
2177:       if (
2178:         node.type === 'LabeledStatement' &&
2179:         node.label.name === 'ref' &&
2180:         node.body.type === 'ExpressionStatement'
2181:       ) {
2182:         error(
2183:           `ref sugar using the label syntax was an experimental proposal and ` +
2184:             `has been dropped based on community feedback. Please check out ` +
2185:             `the new proposal at https://github.com/vuejs/rfcs/discussions/369`,
2186:           node
2187:         )
2188:       }
2189:   
2190:       if (node.type === 'ImportDeclaration') {
2191:         // import declarations are moved to top
2192:         s.move(start, end, 0)
2193:   
2194:         // dedupe imports
2195:         let removed = 0
2196:         const removeSpecifier = (i) => {
2197:           const removeLeft = i > removed
2198:           removed++
2199:           const current = node.specifiers[i]
2200:           const next = node.specifiers[i + 1]
2201:           s.remove(
2202:             removeLeft
2203:               ? node.specifiers[i - 1].end + startOffset
2204:               : current.start + startOffset,
2205:             next && !removeLeft
2206:               ? next.start + startOffset
2207:               : current.end + startOffset
2208:           )
2209:         }
2210:   
2211:         for (let i = 0; i < node.specifiers.length; i++) {
2212:           const specifier = node.specifiers[i]
2213:           const local = specifier.local.name
2214:           const imported =
2215:             specifier.type === 'ImportSpecifier' &&
2216:             specifier.imported.type === 'Identifier' &&
2217:             specifier.imported.name
2218:           const source = node.source.value
2219:           const existing = userImports[local]
2220:           if (
2221:             source === 'vue' &&
2222:             (imported === DEFINE_PROPS ||
2223:               imported === DEFINE_EMITS ||
2224:               imported === DEFINE_EXPOSE)
2225:           ) {
2226:             removeSpecifier(i)
2227:           } else if (existing) {
2228:             if (existing.source === source && existing.imported === imported) {
2229:               // already imported in <script setup>, dedupe
2230:               removeSpecifier(i)
2231:             } else {
2232:               error(`different imports aliased to same local name.`, specifier)
2233:             }
2234:           } else {
2235:             registerUserImport(
2236:               source,
2237:               local,
2238:               imported,
2239:               node.importKind === 'type' ||
2240:                 (specifier.type === 'ImportSpecifier' &&
2241:                   specifier.importKind === 'type'),
2242:               true
2243:             )
2244:           }
2245:         }
2246:         if (node.specifiers.length && removed === node.specifiers.length) {
2247:           s.remove(node.start + startOffset, node.end + startOffset)
2248:         }
2249:       }
2250:   
2251:       if (node.type === 'ExpressionStatement') {
2252:         // process `defineProps` and `defineEmit(s)` calls
2253:         if (
2254:           processDefineProps(node.expression) ||
2255:           processDefineEmits(node.expression) ||
2256:           processWithDefaults(node.expression)
2257:         ) {
2258:           s.remove(node.start + startOffset, node.end + startOffset)
2259:         } else if (processDefineExpose(node.expression)) {
2260:           // defineExpose({}) -> expose({})
2261:           const callee = node.expression.callee
2262:           s.overwrite(
2263:             callee.start + startOffset,
2264:             callee.end + startOffset,
2265:             'expose'
2266:           )
2267:         }
2268:       }
2269:   
2270:       if (node.type === 'VariableDeclaration' && !node.declare) {
2271:         const total = node.declarations.length
2272:         let left = total
2273:         for (let i = 0; i < total; i++) {
2274:           const decl = node.declarations[i]
2275:           if (decl.init) {
2276:             // defineProps / defineEmits
2277:             const isDefineProps =
2278:               processDefineProps(decl.init, decl.id) ||
2279:               processWithDefaults(decl.init, decl.id)
2280:             const isDefineEmits = processDefineEmits(decl.init, decl.id)
2281:             if (isDefineProps || isDefineEmits) {
2282:               if (left === 1) {
2283:                 s.remove(node.start + startOffset, node.end + startOffset)
2284:               } else {
2285:                 let start = decl.start + startOffset
2286:                 let end = decl.end + startOffset
2287:                 if (i < total - 1) {
2288:                   // not the last one, locate the start of the next
2289:                   end = node.declarations[i + 1].start + startOffset
2290:                 } else {
2291:                   // last one, locate the end of the prev
2292:                   start = node.declarations[i - 1].end + startOffset
2293:                 }
2294:                 s.remove(start, end)
2295:                 left--
2296:               }
2297:             }
2298:           }
2299:         }
2300:       }
2301:   
2302:       // walk declarations to record declared bindings
2303:       if (
2304:         (node.type === 'VariableDeclaration' ||
2305:           node.type === 'FunctionDeclaration' ||
2306:           node.type === 'ClassDeclaration') &&
2307:         !node.declare
2308:       ) {
2309:         walkDeclaration(node, setupBindings, userImportAlias)
2310:       }
2311:   
2312:       // walk statements & named exports / variable declarations for top level
2313:       // await
2314:       if (
2315:         (node.type === 'VariableDeclaration' && !node.declare) ||
2316:         node.type.endsWith('Statement')
2317:       ) {
2318:         walk(node, {
2319:           enter(child, parent) {
2320:             if (isFunctionType(child)) {
2321:               this.skip()
2322:             }
2323:             if (child.type === 'AwaitExpression') {
2324:               hasAwait = true
2325:               const needsSemi = scriptSetupAst.body.some(n => {
2326:                 return n.type === 'ExpressionStatement' && n.start === child.start
2327:               })
2328:               processAwait(
2329:                 child,
2330:                 needsSemi,
2331:                 parent.type === 'ExpressionStatement'
2332:               )
2333:             }
2334:           }
2335:         })
2336:       }
2337:   
2338:       if (
2339:         (node.type === 'ExportNamedDeclaration' && node.exportKind !== 'type') ||
2340:         node.type === 'ExportAllDeclaration' ||
2341:         node.type === 'ExportDefaultDeclaration'
2342:       ) {
2343:         error(
2344:           `<script setup> cannot contain ES module exports. ` +
2345:             `If you are using a previous version of <script setup>, please ` +
2346:             `consult the updated RFC at https://github.com/vuejs/rfcs/pull/227.`,
2347:           node
2348:         )
2349:       }
2350:   
2351:       if (isTS) {
2352:         // runtime enum
2353:         if (node.type === 'TSEnumDeclaration') {
2354:           registerBinding(setupBindings, node.id, BindingTypes.SETUP_CONST)
2355:         }
2356:   
2357:         // move all Type declarations to outer scope
2358:         if (
2359:           node.type.startsWith('TS') ||
2360:           (node.type === 'ExportNamedDeclaration' &&
2361:             node.exportKind === 'type') ||
2362:           (node.type === 'VariableDeclaration' && node.declare)
2363:         ) {
2364:           recordType(node, declaredTypes)
2365:           s.move(start, end, 0)
2366:         }
2367:       }
2368:     }
2369:   
2370:     return scriptSetupAst
2371:   }
2372:   function applyReactivityTransform() {
2373:     if (
2374:       (enableReactivityTransform &&
2375:         // normal <script> had ref bindings that maybe used in <script setup>
2376:         (refBindings || RT.shouldTransform(scriptSetup.content))) ||
2377:       propsDestructureDecl
2378:     ) {
2379:       const { rootRefs, importedHelpers } = transformAST(
2380:         scriptSetupAst,
2381:         s,
2382:         startOffset,
2383:         refBindings,
2384:         propsDestructuredBindings
2385:       )
2386:       refBindings = refBindings ? [...refBindings, ...rootRefs] : rootRefs
2387:       for (const h of importedHelpers) {
2388:         helperImports.add(h)
2389:       }
2390:     }
2391:   }
2392:   function extractRuntimePropsEmits() {
2393:     if (propsTypeDecl) {
2394:       extractRuntimeProps(propsTypeDecl, typeDeclaredProps, declaredTypes, isProd)
2395:     }
2396:     if (emitsTypeDecl) {
2397:       extractRuntimeEmits(emitsTypeDecl, typeDeclaredEmits)
2398:     }
2399:   }
2400:   function checkUseOptions() {
2401:     checkInvalidScopeReference(propsRuntimeDecl, DEFINE_PROPS)
2402:     checkInvalidScopeReference(propsRuntimeDefaults, DEFINE_PROPS)
2403:     checkInvalidScopeReference(propsDestructureDecl, DEFINE_PROPS)
2404:     checkInvalidScopeReference(emitsRuntimeDecl, DEFINE_PROPS)
2405:   }
2406:   function removeNonScriptContent() {
2407:     if (script) {
2408:       if (startOffset < scriptStartOffset) {
2409:         // <script setup> before <script>
2410:         s.remove(0, startOffset)
2411:         s.remove(endOffset, scriptStartOffset)
2412:         s.remove(scriptEndOffset, source.length)
2413:       } else {
2414:         // <script> before <script setup>
2415:         s.remove(0, scriptStartOffset)
2416:         s.remove(scriptEndOffset, startOffset)
2417:         s.remove(endOffset, source.length)
2418:       }
2419:     } else {
2420:       // only <script setup>
2421:       s.remove(0, startOffset)
2422:       s.remove(endOffset, source.length)
2423:     }
2424:   }
2425:   function analyzeBindingMetadata() {
2426:     if (scriptAst) {
2427:       Object.assign(bindingMetadata, analyzeScriptBindings(scriptAst.body))
2428:     }
2429:     if (propsRuntimeDecl) {
2430:       for (const key of getObjectOrArrayExpressionKeys(propsRuntimeDecl)) {
2431:         bindingMetadata[key] = BindingTypes.PROPS
2432:       }
2433:     }
2434:     for (const key in typeDeclaredProps) {
2435:       bindingMetadata[key] = BindingTypes.PROPS
2436:     }
2437:     // props aliases
2438:     if (propsDestructureDecl) {
2439:       if (propsDestructureRestId) {
2440:         bindingMetadata[propsDestructureRestId] = BindingTypes.SETUP_CONST
2441:       }
2442:       for (const key in propsDestructuredBindings) {
2443:         const { local } = propsDestructuredBindings[key]
2444:         if (local !== key) {
2445:           bindingMetadata[local] = BindingTypes.PROPS_ALIASED
2446:           ;(bindingMetadata.__propsAliases ||
2447:             (bindingMetadata.__propsAliases = {}))[local] = key
2448:         }
2449:       }
2450:     }
2451:     for (const [key, { isType, imported, source }] of Object.entries(
2452:       userImports
2453:     )) {
2454:       if (isType) continue
2455:       bindingMetadata[key] =
2456:         (imported === 'default' && source.endsWith('.vue')) || source === 'vue'
2457:           ? BindingTypes.SETUP_CONST
2458:           : BindingTypes.SETUP_MAYBE_REF
2459:     }
2460:     for (const key in scriptBindings) {
2461:       bindingMetadata[key] = scriptBindings[key]
2462:     }
2463:     for (const key in setupBindings) {
2464:       bindingMetadata[key] = setupBindings[key]
2465:     }
2466:     // known ref bindings
2467:     if (refBindings) {
2468:       for (const key of refBindings) {
2469:         bindingMetadata[key] = BindingTypes.SETUP_REF
2470:       }
2471:     }
2472:   }
2473:   function injectUseCssVarsCalls() {
2474:     if (cssVars.length) {
2475:       helperImports.add(CSS_VARS_HELPER)
2476:       helperImports.add('unref')
2477:       s.prependRight(
2478:         startOffset,
2479:         `\n${genCssVarsCode(cssVars, bindingMetadata, scopeId, isProd)}\n`
2480:       )
2481:     }
2482:   }
2483:   function finalizeSetupArgumentSignature() {
2484:     if (propsTypeDecl) {
2485:       // mark as any and only cast on assignment
2486:       // since the user defined complex types may be incompatible with the
2487:       // inferred type from generated runtime declarations
2488:       args += `: any`
2489:     }
2490:     // inject user assignment of props
2491:     // we use a default __props so that template expressions referencing props
2492:     // can use it directly
2493:     if (propsIdentifier) {
2494:       s.prependLeft(
2495:         startOffset,
2496:         `\nconst ${propsIdentifier} = __props${
2497:           propsTypeDecl ? ` as ${genSetupPropsType(propsTypeDecl)}` : ``
2498:         }\n`
2499:       )
2500:     }
2501:     if (propsDestructureRestId) {
2502:       s.prependLeft(
2503:         startOffset,
2504:         `\nconst ${propsDestructureRestId} = ${helper(
2505:           `createPropsRestProxy`
2506:         )}(__props, ${JSON.stringify(Object.keys(propsDestructuredBindings))})\n`
2507:       )
2508:     }
2509:     // inject temp variables for async context preservation
2510:     if (hasAwait) {
2511:       const any = isTS ? `: any` : ``
2512:       s.prependLeft(startOffset, `\nlet __temp${any}, __restore${any}\n`)
2513:     }
2514:   
2515:     const destructureElements =
2516:       hasDefineExposeCall || !options.inlineTemplate ? [`expose`] : []
2517:     if (emitIdentifier) {
2518:       destructureElements.push(
2519:         emitIdentifier === `emit` ? `emit` : `emit: ${emitIdentifier}`
2520:       )
2521:     }
2522:     if (destructureElements.length) {
2523:       args += `, { ${destructureElements.join(', ')} }`
2524:       if (emitsTypeDecl) {
2525:         args += `: { emit: (${scriptSetup.content.slice(
2526:           emitsTypeDecl.start,
2527:           emitsTypeDecl.end
2528:         )}), expose: any, slots: any, attrs: any }`
2529:       }
2530:     }
2531:   }
2532:   function finalizeSetupArgumentSignature() {
2533:     if (propsTypeDecl) {
2534:       // mark as any and only cast on assignment
2535:       // since the user defined complex types may be incompatible with the
2536:       // inferred type from generated runtime declarations
2537:       args += `: any`
2538:     }
2539:     // inject user assignment of props
2540:     // we use a default __props so that template expressions referencing props
2541:     // can use it directly
2542:     if (propsIdentifier) {
2543:       s.prependLeft(
2544:         startOffset,
2545:         `\nconst ${propsIdentifier} = __props${
2546:           propsTypeDecl ? ` as ${genSetupPropsType(propsTypeDecl)}` : ``
2547:         }\n`
2548:       )
2549:     }
2550:     if (propsDestructureRestId) {
2551:       s.prependLeft(
2552:         startOffset,
2553:         `\nconst ${propsDestructureRestId} = ${helper(
2554:           `createPropsRestProxy`
2555:         )}(__props, ${JSON.stringify(Object.keys(propsDestructuredBindings))})\n`
2556:       )
2557:     }
2558:     // inject temp variables for async context preservation
2559:     if (hasAwait) {
2560:       const any = isTS ? `: any` : ``
2561:       s.prependLeft(startOffset, `\nlet __temp${any}, __restore${any}\n`)
2562:     }
2563:   
2564:     const destructureElements =
2565:       hasDefineExposeCall || !options.inlineTemplate ? [`expose`] : []
2566:     if (emitIdentifier) {
2567:       destructureElements.push(
2568:         emitIdentifier === `emit` ? `emit` : `emit: ${emitIdentifier}`
2569:       )
2570:     }
2571:     if (destructureElements.length) {
2572:       args += `, { ${destructureElements.join(', ')} }`
2573:       if (emitsTypeDecl) {
2574:         args += `: { emit: (${scriptSetup.content.slice(
2575:           emitsTypeDecl.start,
2576:           emitsTypeDecl.end
2577:         )}), expose: any, slots: any, attrs: any }`
2578:       }
2579:     }
2580:   }
2581:   function generateReturnStatement() {
2582:     if (options.inlineTemplate) {
2583:       if (sfc.template && !sfc.template.src) {
2584:         if (options.templateOptions && options.templateOptions.ssr) {
2585:           hasInlinedSsrRenderFn = true
2586:         }
2587:         // inline render function mode - we are going to compile the template and
2588:         // inline it right here
2589:         const { code, ast, preamble, tips, errors } = compileTemplate({
2590:           filename,
2591:           source: sfc.template.content,
2592:           inMap: sfc.template.map,
2593:           ...options.templateOptions,
2594:           id: scopeId,
2595:           scoped: sfc.styles.some(s => s.scoped),
2596:           isProd: options.isProd,
2597:           ssrCssVars: sfc.cssVars,
2598:           compilerOptions: {
2599:             ...(options.templateOptions &&
2600:               options.templateOptions.compilerOptions),
2601:             inline: true,
2602:             isTS,
2603:             bindingMetadata
2604:           }
2605:         })
2606:   
2607:         const err = errors[0]
2608:         if (typeof err === 'string') {
2609:           throw new Error(err)
2610:         } else if (err) {
2611:           if (err.loc) {
2612:             err.message +=
2613:               `\n\n` +
2614:               sfc.filename +
2615:               '\n' +
2616:               generateCodeFrame(
2617:                 source,
2618:                 err.loc.start.offset,
2619:                 err.loc.end.offset
2620:               ) +
2621:               `\n`
2622:           }
2623:           throw err
2624:         }
2625:         if (preamble) {
2626:           s.prepend(preamble)
2627:         }
2628:         // avoid duplicated unref import
2629:         // as this may get injected by the render function preamble OR the
2630:         // css vars codegen
2631:         if (ast && ast.helpers.includes(UNREF)) {
2632:           helperImports.delete('unref')
2633:         }
2634:         returned = code
2635:       } else {
2636:         returned = `() => {}`
2637:       }
2638:     } else {
2639:       // return bindings from script and script setup
2640:       const allBindings= {
2641:         ...scriptBindings,
2642:         ...setupBindings
2643:       }
2644:       for (const key in userImports) {
2645:         if (!userImports[key].isType && userImports[key].isUsedInTemplate) {
2646:           allBindings[key] = true
2647:         }
2648:       }
2649:       returned = `{ ${Object.keys(allBindings).join(', ')} }`
2650:     }
2651:   
2652:     if (!options.inlineTemplate) {
2653:       // in non-inline mode, the `__isScriptSetup: true` flag is used by
2654:       // componentPublicInstance proxy to allow properties that start with $ or _
2655:       s.appendRight(
2656:         endOffset,
2657:         `\nconst __returned__ = ${returned}\n` +
2658:           `Object.defineProperty(__returned__, '__isScriptSetup', { enumerable: false, value: true })\n` +
2659:           `return __returned__` +
2660:           `\n}\n\n`
2661:       )
2662:     } else {
2663:       s.appendRight(endOffset, `\nreturn ${returned}\n}\n\n`)
2664:     }
2665:   }
2666:   function finalizeDefaultExport() {
2667:     let runtimeOptions = ``
2668:     if (hasInlinedSsrRenderFn) {
2669:       runtimeOptions += `\n  __ssrInlineRender: true,`
2670:     }
2671:     if (propsRuntimeDecl) {
2672:       let declCode = scriptSetup.content
2673:         .slice(propsRuntimeDecl.start, propsRuntimeDecl.end)
2674:         .trim()
2675:       if (propsDestructureDecl) {
2676:         const defaults = []
2677:         for (const key in propsDestructuredBindings) {
2678:           const d = genDestructuredDefaultValue(key)
2679:           if (d) defaults.push(`${key}: ${d}`)
2680:         }
2681:         if (defaults.length) {
2682:           declCode = `${helper(
2683:             `mergeDefaults`
2684:           )}(${declCode}, {\n  ${defaults.join(',\n  ')}\n})`
2685:         }
2686:       }
2687:       runtimeOptions += `\n  props: ${declCode},`
2688:     } else if (propsTypeDecl) {
2689:       runtimeOptions += genRuntimeProps(typeDeclaredProps)
2690:     }
2691:     if (emitsRuntimeDecl) {
2692:       runtimeOptions += `\n  emits: ${scriptSetup.content
2693:         .slice(emitsRuntimeDecl.start, emitsRuntimeDecl.end)
2694:         .trim()},`
2695:     } else if (emitsTypeDecl) {
2696:       runtimeOptions += genRuntimeEmits(typeDeclaredEmits)
2697:     }
2698:   
2699:     // <script setup> components are closed by default. If the user did not
2700:     // explicitly call `defineExpose`, call expose() with no args.
2701:     const exposeCall =
2702:       hasDefineExposeCall || options.inlineTemplate ? `` : `  expose();\n`
2703:     // wrap setup code with function.
2704:     if (isTS) {
2705:       // for TS, make sure the exported type is still valid type with
2706:       // correct props information
2707:       // we have to use object spread for types to be merged properly
2708:       // user's TS setting should compile it down to proper targets
2709:       // export default defineComponent({ ...__default__, ... })
2710:       const def = defaultExport ? `\n  ...${DEFAULT_VAR},` : ``
2711:       s.prependLeft(
2712:         startOffset,
2713:         `\nexport default /*#__PURE__*/${helper(
2714:           `defineComponent`
2715:         )}({${def}${runtimeOptions}\n  ${
2716:           hasAwait ? `async ` : ``
2717:         }setup(${args}) {\n${exposeCall}`
2718:       )
2719:       s.appendRight(endOffset, `})`)
2720:     } else {
2721:       if (defaultExport) {
2722:         // without TS, can't rely on rest spread, so we use Object.assign
2723:         // export default Object.assign(__default__, { ... })
2724:         s.prependLeft(
2725:           startOffset,
2726:           `\nexport default /*#__PURE__*/Object.assign(${DEFAULT_VAR}, {${runtimeOptions}\n  ` +
2727:             `${hasAwait ? `async ` : ``}setup(${args}) {\n${exposeCall}`
2728:         )
2729:         s.appendRight(endOffset, `})`)
2730:       } else {
2731:         s.prependLeft(
2732:           startOffset,
2733:           `\nexport default {${runtimeOptions}\n  ` +
2734:             `${hasAwait ? `async ` : ``}setup(${args}) {\n${exposeCall}`
2735:         )
2736:         s.appendRight(endOffset, `}`)
2737:       }
2738:     }
2739:   }
2740:   function finalizeVueHelperImports() {
2741:     if (helperImports.size > 0) {
2742:       s.prepend(
2743:         `import { ${[...helperImports]
2744:           .map(h => `${h} as _${h}`)
2745:           .join(', ')} } from 'vue'\n`
2746:       )
2747:     }
2748:   }
2749: 
2750:   // 1. process normal <script> first if it exists
2751:   let scriptAst = processNormalScript()
2752:   // 2. parse <script setup> and  walk over top level statements
2753:   const scriptSetupAst = processSetupScript()
2754: 
2755:   // 3. Apply reactivity transform
2756:   applyReactivityTransform()
2757:   // 4. extract runtime props/emits code from setup context type
2758:   extractRuntimePropsEmits()
2759:   // 5. check useOptions args to make sure it doesn't reference setup scope
2760:   // variables
2761:   checkUseOptions()
2762:   // 6. remove non-script content
2763:   removeNonScriptContent()
2764:   // 7. analyze binding metadata
2765:   analyzeBindingMetadata()
2766:   // 8. inject `useCssVars` calls
2767:   injectUseCssVarsCalls()
2768:   // 9. finalize setup() argument signature
2769:   let args = `__props`
2770:   finalizeSetupArgumentSignature()
2771:   // 10. generate return statement
2772:   let returned
2773:   generateReturnStatement()
2774:   // 11. finalize default export
2775:   let runtimeOptions = ''
2776:   finalizeDefaultExport()
2777:   // 12. finalize Vue helper imports
2778:   finalizeVueHelperImports()
2779: 
2780:   s.trim()
2781: 
2782:   return {
2783:     ...scriptSetup,
2784:     bindings: bindingMetadata,
2785:     imports: userImports,
2786:     content: s.toString(),
2787:     map: genSourceMap
2788:       ? (s.generateMap({
2789:           source: filename,
2790:           hires: true,
2791:           includeContent: true
2792:         }))
2793:       : undefined,
2794:     scriptAst: scriptAst?.body,
2795:     scriptSetupAst: scriptSetupAst?.body
2796:   }
2797: }

1. script


script codes 
/** jsx?|tsx? file header */
let debugOn = true
let currentLogKey = 'cc'
let __BROWSER__ = typeof window !== 'undefined'
let logs = {}
const __DEV__ = true
const log = (fn, message) => {
  if (debugOn) {
    if (message === undefined) {
      console.log(fn)
    } else {
      console.log(`[${fn}] ${message}`)
    }
  }
}
const logOn = () => (debugOn = true)
const logOff = () => (debugOn = false)
const logEnd = (hint = 'END') => {
  const m = `--------- ${hint} ---------`
  if (debugOn) pushLog(m, 'title')
  return m
}
const logBr = () => console.log('\n')
let debugTraverseOn = false
const logTraverseOn = () => (debugTraverseOn = true)
const logTraverseOff = () => (debugTraverseOn = false)
const logg = (hint, ...msg) => {
  if (!debugTraverseOn && hint === 'traverseNode') return
  if (debugOn) {
    const m = logEnd(hint)
    msg.forEach((m) => pushLog(m))
  }
}
function pushLog(m, type = 'normal') {
  ;(logs[currentLogKey] || (logs[currentLogKey] = [])).push({ value: m, type })
  log(m)
}
function clearLog(key) {
  if (key) {
    logs[key] = []
  } else {
    logs = {}
  }
}

let w = {}
let debugEle = null
if (__BROWSER__) {
  w = typeof window !== 'undefined' ? window : {}
}
w.log = (msg, isLine = false) => {
  if (debugEle) {
    const cls = ['debug', isLine ? 'line' : ''].filter(Boolen)
    ele.innerHTML = `${debugEl.innerHTML}<pre class="${cls.join(' ')}"><code>${
      typeof msg === 'object' ? syntaxHighlight(msg) : msg
    }</code></pre>`
    return ele.innerHTML
  }
}

function syntaxHighlight(json) {
  if (typeof json != 'string') {
    json = JSON.stringify(json, undefined, 2)
  }
  json = json.replace(/&/g, '&amp;').replace(/</g, '&lt;').replace(/>/g, '&gt;')
  return json.replace(
    /("(\\u[a-zA-Z0-9]{4}|\\[^u]|[^\\"])*"(\s*:)?|\b(true|false|null)\b|-?\d+(?:\.\d*)?(?:[eE][+\-]?\d+)?)/g,
    function (match) {
      var cls = 'number'
      if (/^"/.test(match)) {
        if (/:$/.test(match)) {
          cls = 'key'
        } else {
          cls = 'string'
        }
      } else if (/true|false/.test(match)) {
        cls = 'boolean'
      } else if (/null/.test(match)) {
        cls = 'null'
      }
      return '<span class="' + cls + '">' + match + '</span>'
    }
  )
}

let babelParser
if (!__BROWSER__) {
  babelParser = require(process.env.NODE_LIB + '/@babel/parser')
}
// The default decoder only provides escapes for characters reserved as part of
// the template syntax, and is only used if the custom renderer did not provide
// a platform-specific decoder.
const decodeRE = /&(gt|lt|amp|apos|quot);/g
const decodeMap = {
  gt: '>',
  lt: '<',
  amp: '&',
  apos: "'",
  quot: '"'
}

const EMPTY_OBJ = {}
const NO = () => false
const NOOP = () => {}
const locStub = {
  source: '',
  start: { line: 1, column: 1, offset: 0 },
  end: { line: 1, column: 1, offset: 0 }
}

const ConstantTypes = {
  NOT_CONSTANT: 0,
  CAN_SKIP_PATCH: 1,
  CAN_HOIST: 2,
  CAN_STRINGIFY: 3
}

const ElementTypes = {
  ELEMENT: 0,
  COMPONENT: 1,
  SLOT: 2,
  TEMPLATE: 3
}

const Namespaces = {
  HTML: 0
}

const NodeTypes = {
  ROOT: 0,
  ELEMENT: 1,
  TEXT: 2,
  COMMENT: 3,
  SIMPLE_EXPRESSION: 4,
  INTERPOLATION: 5,
  ATTRIBUTE: 6,
  DIRECTIVE: 7,
  // containers
  COMPOUND_EXPRESSION: 8,
  IF: 9,
  IF_BRANCH: 10,
  FOR: 11,
  TEXT_CALL: 12,
  // codegen
  VNODE_CALL: 13,
  JS_CALL_EXPRESSION: 14,
  JS_OBJECT_EXPRESSION: 15,
  JS_PROPERTY: 16,
  JS_ARRAY_EXPRESSION: 17,
  JS_FUNCTION_EXPRESSION: 18,
  JS_CONDITIONAL_EXPRESSION: 19,
  JS_CACHE_EXPRESSION: 20,

  // ssr codegen
  JS_BLOCK_STATEMENT: 21,
  JS_TEMPLATE_LITERAL: 22,
  JS_IF_STATEMENT: 23,
  JS_ASSIGNMENT_EXPRESSION: 24,
  JS_SEQUENCE_EXPRESSION: 25,
  JS_RETURN_STATEMENT: 26
}

const defaultParserOptions = {
  delimiters: [`{{`, `}}`],
  getNamespace: () => Namespaces.HTML,
  getTextMode: () => TextModes.DATA,
  isVoidTag: NO,
  isPreTag: NO,
  isCustomElement: NO,
  decodeEntities: (rawText) =>
    rawText.replace(decodeRE, (_, p1) => decodeMap[p1]),
  onError: defaultOnError,
  onWarn: defaultOnWarn,
  comments: __DEV__
}

const TagType = {
  Start: 0,
  End: 1
}

const TextModes = {
  DATA: 0,
  RCDATA: 1,
  RAWTEXT: 2,
  CDATA: 3,
  ATTRIBUTE_VALUE: 4
}

const extend = Object.assign

function defaultOnError(error) {
  throw error
}

function defaultOnWarn(msg) {
  __DEV__ && console.warn(`[Vue warn] ${msg.message}`)
}

function makeMap(str, expectsLowerCase) {
  const map = Object.create(null)
  const list = str.split(',')
  for (let i = 0; i < list.length; i++) {
    map[list[i]] = true
  }
  return expectsLowerCase
    ? (val) => !!map[val.toLowerCase()]
    : (val) => !!map[val]
}

const hasOwnProperty = Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty
const hasOwn = (val, key) => hasOwnProperty.call(val, key)

const isArray = Array.isArray
const isMap = (val) => toTypeString(val) === '[object Map]'
const isSet = (val) => toTypeString(val) === '[object Set]'

const isDate = (val) => val instanceof Date
const isFunction = (val) => typeof val === 'function'
const isString = (val) => typeof val === 'string'
const isSymbol = (val) => typeof val === 'symbol'
const isObject = (val) => val !== null && typeof val === 'object'
const onRE = /^on[^a-z]/
const isOn = (key) => onRE.test(key)

const isPromise = (val) => {
  return isObject(val) && isFunction(val.then) && isFunction(val.catch)
}

const objectToString = Object.prototype.toString
const toTypeString = (value) => objectToString.call(value)

const toRawType = (value) => {
  // extract "RawType" from strings like "[object RawType]"
  return toTypeString(value).slice(8, -1)
}

function isText(node) {
  // (isText)
