58:     onWarn: w => warnings.push(w)
59:   })
60: 
61:   return { code, ast, preamble, source, errors, tips, map }
62: }

3. mindmaps

compileScript():

4. global variables


globalVars 
 1: const __ESM_BROWSER__ = false, __GLOBAL__ = true
 2: let MagicString = require(process.env.NODE_LIB + '/magic-string')
 3: 
 4: function createCache(size = 500) {
 5:   return new Map()
 6: }
 7: 
 8: <<rewriteDefault>>
 9: <<reactivity-transform>>
10: 
11: const range = 2
12: 
13: function generateCodeFrame(
14:   source,
15:   start = 0,
16:   end = source.length
17: ) {
18:   // Split the content into individual lines but capture the newline sequence
19:   // that separated each line. This is important because the actual sequence is
20:   // needed to properly take into account the full line length for offset
21:   // comparison
22:   let lines = source.split(/(\r?\n)/)
23: 
24:   // Separate the lines and newline sequences into separate arrays for easier referencing
25:   const newlineSequences = lines.filter((_, idx) => idx % 2 === 1)
26:   lines = lines.filter((_, idx) => idx % 2 === 0)
27: 
28:   let count = 0
29:   const res = []
30:   for (let i = 0; i < lines.length; i++) {
31:     count +=
32:       lines[i].length +
33:       ((newlineSequences[i] && newlineSequences[i].length) || 0)
34:     if (count >= start) {
35:       for (let j = i - range; j <= i + range || end > count; j++) {
36:         if (j < 0 || j >= lines.length) continue
37:         const line = j + 1
38:         res.push(
39:           `${line}${' '.repeat(Math.max(3 - String(line).length, 0))}|  ${
40:             lines[j]
41:           }`
42:         )
43:         const lineLength = lines[j].length
44:         const newLineSeqLength =
45:           (newlineSequences[j] && newlineSequences[j].length) || 0
46: 
47:         if (j === i) {
48:           // push underline
49:           const pad = start - (count - (lineLength + newLineSeqLength))
50:           const length = Math.max(
51:             1,
52:             end > count ? lineLength - pad : end - start
53:           )
54:           res.push(`   |  ` + ' '.repeat(pad) + '^'.repeat(length))
55:         } else if (j > i) {
56:           if (end > count) {
57:             const length = Math.max(Math.min(end - count, lineLength), 1)
58:             res.push(`   |  ` + '^'.repeat(length))
59:           }
60: 
61:           count += lineLength + newLineSeqLength
62:         }
63:       }
64:       break
65:     }
66:   }
67:   return res.join('\n')
68: }
69:

4.1. reactivity-transform

core/README.md at main vuejs/core

script setup $ref(), $computed, $shallowRef(), $customRef(), $toRef(), import ... from "vue" 

  1: const RT = (function() {
  2:   const CONVERT_SYMBOL = '$'
  3: const ESCAPE_SYMBOL = '$$'
  4: const shorthands = ['ref', 'computed', 'shallowRef', 'toRef', 'customRef']
  5: const transformCheckRE = /[^\w]\$(?:\$|ref|computed|shallowRef)?\s*(\(|\<)/
  6: 
  7: function shouldTransform(src) {
  8:   return transformCheckRE.test(src)
  9: }
 10: 
 11: function transform(
 12:   src,
 13:   {
 14:     filename,
 15:     sourceMap,
 16:     parserPlugins,
 17:     importHelpersFrom = 'vue'
 18:   } = {}
 19: ) {
 20:   const plugins = parserPlugins || []
 21:   if (filename) {
 22:     if (/\.tsx?$/.test(filename)) {
 23:       plugins.push('typescript')
 24:     }
 25:     if (filename.endsWith('x')) {
 26:       plugins.push('jsx')
 27:     }
 28:   }
 29: 
 30:   const ast = babelParser.parse(src, {
 31:     sourceType: 'module',
 32:     plugins
 33:   })
 34:   const s = new MagicString(src)
 35:   const res = transformAST(ast.program, s, 0)
 36: 
 37:   // inject helper imports
 38:   if (res.importedHelpers.length) {
 39:     s.prepend(
 40:       `import { ${res.importedHelpers
 41:         .map(h => `${h} as _${h}`)
 42:         .join(', ')} } from '${importHelpersFrom}'\n`
 43:     )
 44:   }
 45: 
 46:   return {
 47:     ...res,
 48:     code: s.toString(),
 49:     map: sourceMap
 50:       ? s.generateMap({
 51:           source: filename,
 52:           hires: true,
 53:           includeContent: true
 54:         })
 55:       : null
 56:   }
 57: }
 58: 
 59: function transformAST(
 60:   ast,
 61:   s,
 62:   offset = 0,
 63:   knownRefs,
 64:   knownProps
 65: ) {
 66:   let convertSymbol = CONVERT_SYMBOL
 67:   let escapeSymbol = ESCAPE_SYMBOL
 68: 
 69:   // macro import handling
 70:   for (const node of ast.body) {
 71:     if (
 72:       node.type === 'ImportDeclaration' &&
 73:       node.source.value === 'vue/macros'
 74:     ) {
 75:       // remove macro imports
 76:       s.remove(node.start + offset, node.end + offset)
 77:       // check aliasing
 78:       for (const specifier of node.specifiers) {
 79:         if (specifier.type === 'ImportSpecifier') {
 80:           const imported = specifier.imported.name
 81:           const local = specifier.local.name
 82:           if (local !== imported) {
 83:             if (imported === ESCAPE_SYMBOL) {
 84:               escapeSymbol = local
 85:             } else if (imported === CONVERT_SYMBOL) {
 86:               convertSymbol = local
 87:             } else {
 88:               error(
 89:                 `macro imports for ref-creating methods do not support aliasing.`,
 90:                 specifier
 91:               )
 92:             }
 93:           }
 94:         }
 95:       }
 96:     }
 97:   }
 98: 
 99:   const importedHelpers = new Set()
100:   const rootScope = {}
101:   const scopeStack = [rootScope]
102:   let currentScope = rootScope
103:   let escapeScope // inside $$()
104:   const excludedIds = new WeakSet()
105:   const parentStack = []
106:   const propsLocalToPublicMap = Object.create(null)
107: 
108:   if (knownRefs) {
109:     for (const key of knownRefs) {
110:       rootScope[key] = true
111:     }
112:   }
113:   if (knownProps) {
114:     for (const key in knownProps) {
115:       const { local } = knownProps[key]
116:       rootScope[local] = 'prop'
117:       propsLocalToPublicMap[local] = key
118:     }
119:   }
120: 
121:   function isRefCreationCall(callee) {
122:     if (callee === convertSymbol) {
123:       return convertSymbol
124:     }
125:     if (callee[0] === '$' && shorthands.includes(callee.slice(1))) {
126:       return callee
127:     }
128:     return false
129:   }
130: 
131:   function error(msg, node) {
132:     const e = new Error(msg)
133:     e.node = node
134:     throw e
135:   }
136: 
137:   function helper(msg) {
138:     importedHelpers.add(msg)
139:     return `_${msg}`
140:   }
141: 
142:   function registerBinding(id, isRef = false) {
143:     excludedIds.add(id)
144:     if (currentScope) {
145:       currentScope[id.name] = isRef
146:     } else {
147:       error(
148:         'registerBinding called without active scope, something is wrong.',
149:         id
150:       )
151:     }
152:   }
153: 
154:   const registerRefBinding = (id) => registerBinding(id, true)
155: 
156:   let tempVarCount = 0
157:   function genTempVar() {
158:     return `__$temp_${++tempVarCount}`
159:   }
160: 
161:   function snip(nod) {
162:     return s.original.slice(node.start + offset, node.end + offset)
163:   }
164: 
165:   function walkScope(node, isRoot = false) {
166:     for (const stmt of node.body) {
167:       if (stmt.type === 'VariableDeclaration') {
168:         walkVariableDeclaration(stmt, isRoot)
169:       } else if (
170:         stmt.type === 'FunctionDeclaration' ||
171:         stmt.type === 'ClassDeclaration'
172:       ) {
173:         if (stmt.declare || !stmt.id) continue
174:         registerBinding(stmt.id)
175:       } else if (
176:         (stmt.type === 'ForOfStatement' || stmt.type === 'ForInStatement') &&
177:         stmt.left.type === 'VariableDeclaration'
178:       ) {
179:         walkVariableDeclaration(stmt.left)
180:       } else if (
181:         stmt.type === 'ExportNamedDeclaration' &&
182:         stmt.declaration &&
183:         stmt.declaration.type === 'VariableDeclaration'
184:       ) {
185:         walkVariableDeclaration(stmt.declaration, isRoot)
186:       } else if (
187:         stmt.type === 'LabeledStatement' &&
188:         stmt.body.type === 'VariableDeclaration'
189:       ) {
190:         walkVariableDeclaration(stmt.body, isRoot)
191:       }
192:     }
193:   }
194: 
195:   function walkVariableDeclaration(stmt, isRoot = false) {
196:     if (stmt.declare) {
197:       return
198:     }
199:     for (const decl of stmt.declarations) {
200:       let refCall
201:       const isCall =
202:         decl.init &&
203:         decl.init.type === 'CallExpression' &&
204:         decl.init.callee.type === 'Identifier'
205:       if (
206:         isCall &&
207:         (refCall = isRefCreationCall(decl.init.callee.name))
208:       ) {
209:         processRefDeclaration(refCall, decl.id, decl.init)
210:       } else {
211:         const isProps =
212:           isRoot && isCall && decl.init.callee.name === 'defineProps'
213:         for (const id of extractIdentifiers(decl.id)) {
214:           if (isProps) {
215:             // for defineProps destructure, only exclude them since they
216:             // are already passed in as knownProps
217:             excludedIds.add(id)
218:           } else {
219:             registerBinding(id)
220:           }
221:         }
222:       }
223:     }
224:   }
225: 
226:   function processRefDeclaration(method, id, call) {
227:     excludedIds.add(call.callee)
228:     if (method === convertSymbol) {
229:       // $
230:       // remove macro
231:       s.remove(call.callee.start + offset, call.callee.end + offset)
232:       if (id.type === 'Identifier') {
233:         // single variable
234:         registerRefBinding(id)
235:       } else if (id.type === 'ObjectPattern') {
236:         processRefObjectPattern(id, call)
237:       } else if (id.type === 'ArrayPattern') {
238:         processRefArrayPattern(id, call)
239:       }
240:     } else {
241:       // shorthands
242:       if (id.type === 'Identifier') {
243:         registerRefBinding(id)
244:         // replace call
245:         s.overwrite(
246:           call.start + offset,
247:           call.start + method.length + offset,
248:           helper(method.slice(1))
249:         )
250:       } else {
251:         error(`${method}() cannot be used with destructure patterns.`, call)
252:       }
253:     }
254:   }
255: 
256:   function processRefObjectPattern(pattern, call, tempVar, path = []) {
257:     if (!tempVar) {
258:       tempVar = genTempVar()
259:       // const { x } = $(useFoo()) --> const __$temp_1 = useFoo()
260:       s.overwrite(pattern.start + offset, pattern.end + offset, tempVar)
261:     }
262: 
263:     for (const p of pattern.properties) {
264:       let nameId
265:       let key
266:       let defaultValue
267:       if (p.type === 'ObjectProperty') {
268:         if (p.key.start === p.value.start) {
269:           // shorthand { foo }
270:           nameId = p.key
271:           if (p.value.type === 'Identifier') {
272:             // avoid shorthand value identifier from being processed
273:             excludedIds.add(p.value)
274:           } else if (
275:             p.value.type === 'AssignmentPattern' &&
276:             p.value.left.type === 'Identifier'
277:           ) {
278:             // { foo = 1 }
279:             excludedIds.add(p.value.left)
280:             defaultValue = p.value.right
281:           }
282:         } else {
283:           key = p.computed ? p.key : p.key.name
284:           if (p.value.type === 'Identifier') {
285:             // { foo: bar }
286:             nameId = p.value
287:           } else if (p.value.type === 'ObjectPattern') {
288:             processRefObjectPattern(p.value, call, tempVar, [...path, key])
289:           } else if (p.value.type === 'ArrayPattern') {
290:             processRefArrayPattern(p.value, call, tempVar, [...path, key])
291:           } else if (p.value.type === 'AssignmentPattern') {
292:             if (p.value.left.type === 'Identifier') {
293:               // { foo: bar = 1 }
294:               nameId = p.value.left
295:               defaultValue = p.value.right
296:             } else if (p.value.left.type === 'ObjectPattern') {
297:               processRefObjectPattern(p.value.left, call, tempVar, [
298:                 ...path,
299:                 [key, p.value.right]
300:               ])
301:             } else if (p.value.left.type === 'ArrayPattern') {
302:               processRefArrayPattern(p.value.left, call, tempVar, [
303:                 ...path,
304:                 [key, p.value.right]
305:               ])
306:             } else {
307:               // MemberExpression case is not possible here, ignore
308:             }
309:           }
310:         }
311:       } else {
312:         // rest element { ...foo }
313:         error(`reactivity destructure does not support rest elements.`, p)
314:       }
315:       if (nameId) {
316:         registerRefBinding(nameId)
317:         // inject toRef() after original replaced pattern
318:         const source = pathToString(tempVar, path)
319:         const keyStr = isString(key)
320:           ? `'${key}'`
321:           : key
322:           ? snip(key)
323:           : `'${nameId.name}'`
324:         const defaultStr = defaultValue ? `, ${snip(defaultValue)}` : ``
325:         s.appendLeft(
326:           call.end + offset,
327:           `,\n  ${nameId.name} = ${helper(
328:             'toRef'
329:           )}(${source}, ${keyStr}${defaultStr})`
330:         )
331:       }
332:     }
333:   }
334: 
335:   function processRefArrayPattern(pattern, call, tempVar, path = []) {
336:     if (!tempVar) {
337:       // const [x] = $(useFoo()) --> const __$temp_1 = useFoo()
338:       tempVar = genTempVar()
339:       s.overwrite(pattern.start + offset, pattern.end + offset, tempVar)
340:     }
341: 
342:     for (let i = 0; i < pattern.elements.length; i++) {
343:       const e = pattern.elements[i]
344:       if (!e) continue
345:       let nameId
346:       let defaultValue
347:       if (e.type === 'Identifier') {
348:         // [a] --> [__a]
349:         nameId = e
350:       } else if (e.type === 'AssignmentPattern') {
351:         // [a = 1]
352:         nameId = e.left
353:         defaultValue = e.right
354:       } else if (e.type === 'RestElement') {
355:         // [...a]
356:         error(`reactivity destructure does not support rest elements.`, e)
357:       } else if (e.type === 'ObjectPattern') {
358:         processRefObjectPattern(e, call, tempVar, [...path, i])
359:       } else if (e.type === 'ArrayPattern') {
360:         processRefArrayPattern(e, call, tempVar, [...path, i])
361:       }
362:       if (nameId) {
363:         registerRefBinding(nameId)
364:         // inject toRef() after original replaced pattern
365:         const source = pathToString(tempVar, path)
366:         const defaultStr = defaultValue ? `, ${snip(defaultValue)}` : ``
367:         s.appendLeft(
368:           call.end + offset,
369:           `,\n  ${nameId.name} = ${helper(
370:             'toRef'
371:           )}(${source}, ${i}${defaultStr})`
372:         )
373:       }
374:     }
375:   }
376: 
377:   function pathToString(source, path) {
378:     if (path.length) {
379:       for (const seg of path) {
380:         if (isArray(seg)) {
381:           source = `(${source}${segToString(seg[0])} || ${snip(seg[1])})`
382:         } else {
383:           source += segToString(seg)
384:         }
385:       }
386:     }
387:     return source
388:   }
389: 
390:   function segToString(seg) {
391:     if (typeof seg === 'number') {
392:       return `[${seg}]`
393:     } else if (typeof seg === 'string') {
394:       return `.${seg}`
395:     } else {
396:       return snip(seg)
397:     }
398:   }
399: 
400:   function rewriteId(scope, id, parent, parentStack) {
401:     if (hasOwn(scope, id.name)) {
402:       const bindingType = scope[id.name]
403:       if (bindingType) {
404:         const isProp = bindingType === 'prop'
405:         if (isStaticProperty(parent) && parent.shorthand) {
406:           // let binding used in a property shorthand
407:           // skip for destructure patterns
408:           if (
409:             !parent.inPattern ||
410:             isInDestructureAssignment(parent, parentStack)
411:           ) {
412:             if (isProp) {
413:               if (escapeScope) {
414:                 // prop binding in $$()
415:                 // { prop } -> { prop: __prop_prop }
416:                 registerEscapedPropBinding(id)
417:                 s.appendLeft(
418:                   id.end + offset,
419:                   `: __props_${propsLocalToPublicMap[id.name]}`
420:                 )
421:               } else {
422:                 // { prop } -> { prop: __prop.prop }
423:                 s.appendLeft(
424:                   id.end + offset,
425:                   `: __props.${propsLocalToPublicMap[id.name]}`
426:                 )
427:               }
428:             } else {
429:               // { foo } -> { foo: foo.value }
430:               s.appendLeft(id.end + offset, `: ${id.name}.value`)
431:             }
432:           }
433:         } else {
434:           if (isProp) {
435:             if (escapeScope) {
436:               // x --> __props_x
437:               registerEscapedPropBinding(id)
438:               s.overwrite(
439:                 id.start + offset,
440:                 id.end + offset,
441:                 `__props_${propsLocalToPublicMap[id.name]}`
442:               )
443:             } else {
444:               // x --> __props.x
445:               s.overwrite(
446:                 id.start + offset,
447:                 id.end + offset,
448:                 `__props.${propsLocalToPublicMap[id.name]}`
449:               )
450:             }
451:           } else {
452:             // x --> x.value
453:             s.appendLeft(id.end + offset, '.value')
454:           }
455:         }
456:       }
457:       return true
458:     }
459:     return false
460:   }
461: 
462:   const propBindingRefs = {}
463:   function registerEscapedPropBinding(id) {
464:     if (!propBindingRefs.hasOwnProperty(id.name)) {
465:       propBindingRefs[id.name] = true
466:       const publicKey = propsLocalToPublicMap[id.name]
467:       s.prependRight(
468:         offset,
469:         `const __props_${publicKey} = ${helper(
470:           `toRef`
471:         )}(__props, '${publicKey}')\n`
472:       )
473:     }
474:   }
475: 
476:   // check root scope first
477:   walkScope(ast, true)
478:   walk(ast, {
479:     enter(node, parent) {
480:       parent && parentStack.push(parent)
481: 
482:       // function scopes
483:       if (isFunctionType(node)) {
484:         scopeStack.push((currentScope = {}))
485:         walkFunctionParams(node, registerBinding)
486:         if (node.body.type === 'BlockStatement') {
487:           walkScope(node.body)
488:         }
489:         return
490:       }
491: 
492:       // catch param
493:       if (node.type === 'CatchClause') {
494:         scopeStack.push((currentScope = {}))
495:         if (node.param && node.param.type === 'Identifier') {
496:           registerBinding(node.param)
497:         }
498:         walkScope(node.body)
499:         return
500:       }
501: 
502:       // non-function block scopes
503:       if (node.type === 'BlockStatement' && !isFunctionType(parent)) {
504:         scopeStack.push((currentScope = {}))
505:         walkScope(node)
506:         return
507:       }
508: 
509:       // skip type nodes
510:       if (
511:         parent &&
512:         parent.type.startsWith('TS') &&
513:         parent.type !== 'TSAsExpression' &&
514:         parent.type !== 'TSNonNullExpression' &&
515:         parent.type !== 'TSTypeAssertion'
516:       ) {
517:         return this.skip()
518:       }
519: 
520:       if (
521:         node.type === 'Identifier' &&
522:         // if inside $$(), skip unless this is a destructured prop binding
523:         !(escapeScope && rootScope[node.name] !== 'prop') &&
524:         isReferencedIdentifier(node, parent, parentStack) &&
525:         !excludedIds.has(node)
526:       ) {
527:         // walk up the scope chain to check if id should be appended .value
528:         let i = scopeStack.length
529:         while (i--) {
530:           if (rewriteId(scopeStack[i], node, parent, parentStack)) {
531:             return
532:           }
533:         }
534:       }
535: 
536:       if (node.type === 'CallExpression' && node.callee.type === 'Identifier') {
537:         const callee = node.callee.name
538: 
539:         const refCall = isRefCreationCall(callee)
540:         if (refCall && (!parent || parent.type !== 'VariableDeclarator')) {
541:           return error(
542:             `${refCall} can only be used as the initializer of ` +
543:               `a variable declaration.`,
544:             node
545:           )
546:         }
547: 
548:         if (callee === escapeSymbol) {
549:           s.remove(node.callee.start + offset, node.callee.end + offset)
550:           escapeScope = node
551:         }
552: 
553:         // TODO remove when out of experimental
554:         if (callee === '$raw') {
555:           error(
556:             `$raw() has been replaced by $$(). ` +
557:               `See ${RFC_LINK} for latest updates.`,
558:             node
559:           )
560:         }
561:         if (callee === '$fromRef') {
562:           error(
563:             `$fromRef() has been replaced by $(). ` +
564:               `See ${RFC_LINK} for latest updates.`,
565:             node
566:           )
567:         }
568:       }
569:     },
570:     leave(node, parent) {
571:       parent && parentStack.pop()
572:       if (
573:         (node.type === 'BlockStatement' && !isFunctionType(parent)) ||
574:         isFunctionType(node)
575:       ) {
576:         scopeStack.pop()
577:         currentScope = scopeStack[scopeStack.length - 1] || null
578:       }
579:       if (node === escapeScope) {
580:         escapeScope = undefined
581:       }
582:     }
583:   })
584: 
585:   return {
586:     rootRefs: Object.keys(rootScope).filter(key => rootScope[key] === true),
587:     importedHelpers: [...importedHelpers]
588:   }
589: }
590: 
591:   return { transformAST, transform, shouldTransform }
592: }())

Author: Zhicheng Lee

Created: 2022-05-05 Thu 16:39
